text: I love this place. Always fresh food and a great place to just have a nice breakfast or brunch either alone on the patio..or at the bar with as few friends. My absolute favorite is the french toast with strawberries...yummy

Went to ncounter for breakfast and thought it was top-notch.  Great selection of breakfast favorites like pancakes, eggs, omelettes, muffins, etc., but also some things that are harder to find.  For instance, my wife had the croque monsieur and loved it.

The location is right next to the light rail stop and the inside has been redone completely.  It looks nothing like the coffee shop that last inhabited the space (and that is definitely a good thing).  

Flavored iced teas are good, as is the orange juice.  I'm really looking forward to going back for lunch, as the sandwiches sound like they'll be as great as the breakfast was.  Give this place a try!

Their breakfast is awesome. It brought me back to life on several occasions.  A lot of the food on their menu is really tasty and different which is cool because theres not a lot of places around like that.

Wow, my roomate took me here when I first moved to Arizona several months ago. I was impressed! The food was awesome, the decor really cute, and they have a cute bar that serves alcoholic beverages. I loved my eggs benedict and would love to return here again sometime soon!

Cheers

The one word I would choose to describe my breakfast was FRESH!  This restaurant was one we had heard about and decided to give it a try.  I ordered the Killer, which consisted of bacon, Gorgonzola, tomato and eggs, sandwich style.   It came with a delicious small mixed salad on the side.   Soooo good!   The Croque Monsieur  consisted of grilled artisan sour dough, tomato, black forest ham, mustard sauce, Gruyere, 2 eggs.  Another outlandishly flavorful breakfast dish!  

I have two suggestions: 1) move the drink bar - it becomes crowded and loses its flow.; 2)  Install shades - all the customers facing towards the windows were experiencing the same issue - sun in their eyes.  Other than that, expect tasty food and great service!
Most delicious and very quick even with a big Sunday brunch crowd!   My eggs were up by the time I got my coffee and a table!

Great vibe and atmosphere. I wish they would put as much effort into their food as they did the concept. I expect a little more out of their food, especially their breakfast. It was a bland assortment of items that are done at home or even as well, and cheaper at Denny's.  Too many other good choices in this area to waste on a so-so, over priced spot.

I've only been to Ncounter once, but I had a pleasant experience and will definitely go back.

My first impression was that I loved how airy and cute and modern the decor is. And it has plenty of seating, which is always good. 

I ordered the Farmer's Market eggs, which are a take on Eggs Benedict, and freshly squeezed OJ. The only hiccup with service was that I didn't realize that they don't bring the OJ out to you w/ the rest of the food and they didn't explain that you actually grab it from a little fridge cart near the counter - but that wasn't a huge deal.

The food came out fairly quickly and my dish was super yummy. Eggs perfectly cooked, a nice hollandaise sauce, decent potatoes... and I love anything w/ spinach and avocado. I'm not exaggerating when I say that I was "this close" to licking my plate clean. 

My co-worker ordered one of their sandwiches and said it was good, and specifically commented how good the bacon was. 

I can't wait to go back and try some of their pastries and coffee.
Great surprise. Friendly, attentive and food a great value.

I went here on recommendation from a friend.  I saw the reviews it had already picked up and figured it couldn't be too bad.  Well, its not too good either.  My first issue is that they don't offer Egg Beaters as a substitute.  Not a big deal, but I had assumed a trendy place and trendy spot might.  Next, the potatoes that were served to me were absolutely from the day before.  We have all had leftover potatoes and know the difference.  Finally, the restrooms and the soap "squeeze" bottle were incredibly filthy.  

Unless you simply can not make scrambled eggs on your own, avoid the hype of this place.

Went to breakfast at Ncounter with my son and his girlfriend. The place was busy. Ordered the pecan and apple pancakes. They were very good.  Just finished up and a server came over asked if we were done. Collected our plates, separated our table as we SAT there and told us he had a table of 6 he needed to seat.  We were literally rushed out of the Restaraunt.  Never has this happened to us. So while I would give the place 4-5 stars the rudeness of the staff left much to be desired.  I get it, it's a hot spot, but I won't go there again.

So excited for a downtown location. We frequented the Mills Ave. location when we lived in Tempe and loved it, and now that we've moved to central PHX this is perfect. I had the Croque Monsieur Benedict.  Ham, tomato, gruyere cheese on a thick toasted slice of sourdough bread, topped with two eggs over medium and hollandaise sauce. DELICIOUS!  Just the right portion too.  Indoor and outdoor patio seating with spray misters to cool off the patio during the hot temps. Covered validated parking (1 hour). This will definitely be our new go to place for breakfast and brunch.

This is an "order at counter and they bring it to you" place. Very good sandwiches that are not run of the Mill. Four of us tried a different sandwich and shared. Each sandwich had it's own personality and pop of flavors. Portions are generous. Home brew tea is refreshing. Inside it's a bit loud with tall ceilings and hard surfaces. Outside seating is ample and nice.  Very clean place. I pleaded with the manager to bring Ncounter to Northern California. Nope. Said he'd expand in the southwest first, so I guess this one place I will put on my list each time I visit Tempe.

Very good menu and food. I got the simply perfect eggs (over medium) toast and sausage with taters with a strawberry smoothie.  Very good.  Got here just in time before it got crazy busy.  Others got the farmers market sandwich and enjoyed that.  Renee got the bona sandwich and loved that. The only downside, but was promptly fixed, Kevin got the simply perfect as well. He had a hair on his plate but they replaced his plate.  So it was fixed and was delish.  If you are in Tempe and want some good breakfast, Ncounter is a great place.

Love the patio, the food is yummy, the place is all around good! I have to say though, turn the AC down, sheesh! It was so cold inside today, we went out and sat in the heat. Also, a warm cinnamon roll should come out before the rest of food, not with it... like an appetizer. That way you aren't struggling to eat it before it gets cold/hard, while your meal gets cold.

I came here on a Sunday morning after spin class and it was very busy. The service was subpar as me and my friend waited next to a dirty table for a good 10 minutes with staff members walking past us and not stopping to address the dirty table. Eventually we had to go ask somebody specifically to come and clean the table. The food however was great. Definitely needs improvement on service.
Great service, lovely atmosphere and top class food. Try the vegetarian omelette... it's awesome!

My husband and I stopped in for a quick breakfast and were blown away by the quality of the food for the affordable price!  It was fast, delicious and the atmosphere was nice.  We loved the fact that they offer a seating area outside for people who have dogs.  We will definitely be coming back!

So much potential but so unfulfilled. When a customer asks whether the strawberries that come with the French toast have anything on them or are just strawberries that does include sugar/ syrup. They were drowned in something. 
Why, when I'm dining in, do I need a coffee served in a takeaway cup with a plastic lid on it? I do know how to drink coffee out of a washable cup, without spilling it.
Sorry to say this was a really disappointing experience.
I won't go often, but if I want breakfast on Mill Ave this my first idea to go to. It's a great idea for a date here instead of meeting them at night too! (Tip)

We live in the neighborhood and used to be here weekly. Lately the food taken a hit. Most of the things we used to order and love are underwhelming. Flavorless (and thereby overpriced). Still a fun place for breakfast with drinks on the patio on a weekend morning (if you can get a table).
Excellent food and great service. Went in with a large group and loved the atmosphere and everyone gave their meal a high rating.

This was my first visit to Ncounter but it won't be my last "encounter" with the place.  The food was good, the service was excellent and the atmosphere was pleasant for such a busy place.  There was plenty of seating, too.  This will be a great place for those headed to a game to stop in for a bite to eat either on the way there or on their way back because the lightrail is right across the street.  I have also tried this owner's other restaurant, T.C. Eggington's in Mesa and really like it too.

Went there for the first time last week and was happily pleased. The banana foster french toast is to die for, and I cant wait to go back and try more menu items. It is a bit pricey but for the quality of the food it's probably worth it. The staff was very friendly and it was an overall good experience.

Ordered the Chorizo and Eggs as a burrito. Food was fresh and tasted good. Portion was large but not shockingly so. Order taker seemed a bit pre-occupied, no smile. Prices seemed a bit high. $8.00 for a burrito. 

Still though, the food was pretty tasty.

Good food and service when empty but on a crowded Saturday morning...the system breaks down. We waited in line for awhile and when it came to be our turn, we watched as the girl at the register talked babble with her colleagues, the other kid at the register took phone orders, another staff member stood there aimlessly, and another one texted. It was unacceptable to have NO staff members at a register to receive orders from the throngs of people in line in the actual establishment. Then after our order of two items (smoothie and muffin) was finally taken, one was never delivered.
Good food for a good price! Everything was presented well, and all of the food was fresh. They seem quite popular! The service was friendly and quick.
The wood picture of the pigs is so crooked it drives me insane. But I'm also obsessed with ncounter. But plz fix.
R.This restaurant has the best bananas foster French toast.  It's a must for us after a hike of the butts across the street in Tempe.

This place is awesome! I have been here about 5 times within about a month, and every time I have been impressed with my meal. The first time I came was for lunch, and I had the Natie Bomb. The combination of turkey and bacon, balanced out by tart-ish apple was amazing. 
On my next visit I came for breakfast, which is by far my favorite meal to eat. This time I got the Santa Fe Sautee, and my wife got the Banana's Foster French. Both meals were absolutely amazing. The coffee is great as well. 

Overall NCounter is a great place to stop by for breakfast or lunch. With delicious food and surprisingly reasonable prices, it adds a great option to the sparse Tempe breakfast scene.

NCounter has a lot going for it--great location, cool design/signage, nice layout and good service.  Its unfortunate that the follow through of food quality did not live up.  On a recent visit to NCounter, I ordered a simple breakfast of eggs and a side of fresh fruit.  What I got concerned me to the point of asking one of their employees--fruit tasted acrid, of preservatives and like no fruit I want to taste again.  I learned from a manager/owner that contrary to their constant use of the word "fresh" on their website and branding, their "fresh fruit" comes out of a can. I understand that this is the unfortunate reality in many restaurants...those, however, are restaurants that do not (and will not) receive my patronage.  NCounter can do better. Until then, I won't be returning. I have no respect for a branding message that is not upheld in their product.

I'm staying in Tempe for the first time, visiting from Chicago and I love this spot for breakfast. I had the veggie omelette and it was delicious. They had plenty of healthful choices along with other breakfast specials to splurge on. I went back the next day and split the French toast with my mom and it was amazing. They use fresh challah bread with cinnamon and it's thick cut. Opted for the strawberries on the side. Fresh berries! The coffee's good too.

Just had a portobelloni sandwich aka mushroom sandwich with blueberry blast smoothy . The sandwich was amazing (since I am a mushroom fan) and the smoothy was good but a little stingy (I expected a smother flavor since it had yogurt in it. My combination of the two wasn't a great one. Nevertheless, individually each item was amazing.

The restaurant location and capacity are above average . The patio seatings are good.My order took 10 minutes to be ready. They would certainly use improvement on the calling for order method. Staff was both helpful and friendly. Overall great place for breakfast and I would definitely be back.

Love, love, love Ncounter! We eat here regularly when we're out taking our walk. Normally we order the spiced oatmeal...best EVER! But I do love their Killer egg sandwich with gorgonzola. It's always cooked perfectly! I also love their Focaccia Roma Chicken sandwich. Oh, and don't forget the pecan cinnamon roll, it is nothing short of amazing. Even my stepson, who lives in SF (the home of fantastic food) comes here every time he's home visiting, just for the oatmeal and cinnamon roll.

Aside from the food, the best thing about this place is the manager, Daniel! He always smiles and says hello when we walk in, stops by our table to check on us (if he has time). Most of the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful if you need something else, e.g. extra milk, condiments, etc. There's a reason they are always busy...because of the great food and the friendly staff.

Love this lil spot...  Great salads and sandwiches and recently met a friend for breakfast and it was delicious.  The French toast was amazing and omelets are tasty.  They have great coffees, even espresso, and   Fresh squeezed juice.  Their bakery items are great for a treat later as well.

I usually bring friends from out of town here and then walk around mill ave afterwards or walk near the lake.  Great location and cute patio area if it's not too hot.  

Great spot... Great food!

Good choice of breakfast and 11 min from the airport. Chill atmosphere and a nice outdoor seating area. The food is fresh and toast is pretty good with the wide selection of omelets with fruit or potatoes.

Very fun atmosphere and really good tasting food. Portions were large but not overwhelming so. Banana walnut pancakes were fragrant, tasty, light, and just the right balance between salty and sweet. Eggs Benedict was also very very good.  Definitely a place to frequent often as long as you don't mind a line, counter ordering, and finding a place to sit without a hostess.

This place is always packed and for good reasons! The food is delicious, fresh, and the amount you pay is reasonable, considering you get a big amount of food on your plate and delicious flavors. The omelets are always great and after trying several breakfast items from the menu, I have never found anything wrong with my food. It is delicious! The only negative comment I would have is that sometimes when the place is extremely packed, my food gets cold due to the amount of time it takes for it to reach my table.

I would have to say this is my absolute FAVORITE spot on Mill. I come here with friends after a night of overindulgence, or my boyfriend for a nice brunch. Their patio is wonderful. I have never had a bad meal here. I really like their chop salad - I usually don't order salads from restaurants but this one blew me away. It was the perfect mix of textures and flavors - sweet cranberries, tangy feta, and that amazing basil pesto dressing. The pear omelette is another one of my go-to breakfasts. I had no idea that pears could taste good on top of eggs but they totally do! My favorite thing about their omelettes is that they are SMOTHERED in cheese. 

If you're hungover, they have amazing fruit smoothies... or if you want hair of the dog, their bloody mary's and bellinis are pretty good. This place is always insanely busy but my service has always been quick, at least for me. Beautiful spot for families, friends, and couples.

Stopped in here this past week to grab breakfast. Had a delicious chai latte and decided to get lunch instead. Had a great sandwich with cream cheese and jalape√±os! Get vibe and atmosphere to! Super modern.
LOVE this place!!!  I always get the Crack O' Dawn, it is fantastic!  Also, the drinks and the cinnamon rolls are delicious.  The perfect place for brunch!  And fast service.

After my 5k on Saturday 2/13, I went into Ncounter with a friend to enjoy a post-run meal. We snagged a table by the door and after about 10 minutes of eating I watched a homeless man, that was struggling to even walk, slowly make his way to exit the door from using the restroom. Just by looking at him, I could tell he hadn't eaten a good meal in awhile, and sadness just emanated from his eyes. I physically could not sit there and not offer him some of my food, which I would have been throwing out anyways.

I invited him to our table to enjoy some of our leftovers.The manager came by immediately and hovered over our table, while very clearly disrespecting the guest which I had invited to our table. Even going out of his way to criticize the man for apparently "begging for our food." I made a point to ensure him that this was not the case. I then asked him, politely, to retrieve a to-go box and some disposable silverware. He found the smallest box possible, neglected to provide silverware, and basically threw it onto the table without saying a word. The manager of this establishment embarrassed me in front of our guest and I was not going to let that fly. After providing the man with food and finally obtaining silverware, the homeless man went on his way and thanked us profusely.

I then went to the back, near the kitchen, and decided to have a word with the manager in front of his employees. Once again, the manager was disrespectful to me, after I had just spent $30 that morning in his restaurant. He lied to my face - telling me that he is always coming in and begging, which I found hard to believe as he was frightened to even talk to us when I physically had to stop him. I told him that because he had embarrassed me in front of my guest and the entire restaurant, I would now be embarrassing him in front of all of his employees for his atrocious arrogance. I will no longer be stepping foot into this establishment, ever again. The manager is a pity excuse for what it means to run a business, and I feel bad for the employees that have to work under him. It is basic human decency to treat everyone with respect, and I hope this taught him a lesson on humility.

Snooze is a much better alternative, with fantastic staff, and is only about 3 minutes away!

If you are in the Tempe area and are looking for a killer breakfast with great service and delicious food, you better go to Ncounter. Walking into Ncounter you may be thrown off by how they operate. Most people may think this system is unappealing, but I am here to tell you why every restaurant should adopt this process. First, you grab a menu to read while you wait in line to order your food and drinks (yes, you wait in line and pay FIRST, but bare with me). I know you may think that this goes against all great restaurant's, but here is some food for thought. Have you ever gone to a restaurant and waited for your server to notice your done eating, ask if your done eating, take way too long to bring the check, and then again take too long to process the check since they are obviously helping with other tables? Well, if you hate that inefficient process as much as I do, then you will love this process. The line moves very quickly and you pay FIRST so that when your done eating, you simply leave whenever you feel like it. GENIOUS. The one carveout I have with Ncounter is that it can be difficult to find a table since it is a very popular place, especially on the weekends. If you are in a group, have one person be scoping out a table to hold for the group. The atmosphere is clean, simple, and somewhat modern. With indoor and outdoor seating, you can bring your pup! They also have a bar area inside and outside so if you are there for a quick bite and don't want to wait in line that is another great option! Not only is the atmosphere amazing, but the restaurant is on Mill Ave. Mill Ave is filled with shopping, dining, events, music, you name it. So after you are done eating, you can walk off the food coma and even take a short hike up A mountain to view Tempe from above. 
Don't be afraid to order one of their Mimosas or Bloody Mary's, which are well balanced and well-priced between 4-5 dollars. They have a variety of options ranging from gourmet omelets to fluffy strawberry pancakes and waffles topped with wiped cream. When I go to Ncounter, I know I am leaving full. They give generous portions that are very well priced. My favorite dish is the Bono. It is a barbeque, egg, tomato, onion, monster of a sandwich that literally makes my mouth water when the server brings it to me. Not only that, you get a side of perfectly cooked potatoes to go with it, just to make sure you leave full. The food comes out very quickly, usually under 10 minutes (I went for lunch during a work break one day and even got back to work early). The servers are always friendly, however, you don't need much contact with them since you pay first, leaving you to enjoy your company, your food, and not breaking your wallet.

I come to Ncounter a lot, I'm such a fan of this cute urban place on mill ace. After yet another amazing meal, I decided to tell and share with others this fantastic Tempe Find. My personal favorite thing is the chipotle egg burrito. It is delicious and nutritious. But don't think you have to try the burrito, they have a range of others including waffles, pancakes & french toast all loaded with fresh fruit and other fun toppings, they also have non breakfast as well like tasty salads, sandwiches, soups and a huge selection of hand crafted beverages. Not is even the best part, they have dog friendly patio :) so if you haven't been here you need to make it your next stop!

First time here and had lunch with my parents. Dad ordered their tuna melt and asked for it without apples, avocado and nuts and he still received it that way and 3 mintes after we received our lunch. Mom had egg salad and their was only a half dollar size amount. I had the portabello 1/2 sandwich. It was ok. We ordered iced green tea and waited 15 minutes to have someone bring us hot tea and then another 5 for the right teas. We waited almost 25 minutes for 3 sandwiches. Food taste fine but service was bad. I mentioned it to a supervisor and he said well their bringing it now. I would not recommend this place.

I absolutely love everything I've ever gotten here. The food tastes fresh and like they use very high quality ingredients. Tends to get very a busy and rightfully so. Probably the best food on Mill Ave!
Searching for breakfast in the area & stumbled on this place! Delicious! Everything was cooked perfectly & tasted great. Yummy tea & coffee also. We will be back.

We ate here twice on a visit to Tempe, both times for lunch and both times ordered the cold turkey and avocado sandwich.  The bread is amazing.  The sandwich is stacked!  Ingredients were fresh.  Service was good & great - at the register a little less than enthusiastic, but we ate at the bar and both servers there were friendly and helpful.  A great switch from our typical pub lunches - we look forward to going back during our next visit to Tempe!

The chocolate chip pancakes were delicious! 
I've had the "farmers market" with eggs cooked over hard, avocado, tomato, spinach, hollandaise & potatoes etc., before and it is excellent too. A 1/2 and 1/2 combination of these two meals would be perfect!!

The restaurant itself was at a great, easy to find location. Parking is next door in the parking garage. Everything looked great. I ordered the french toast with strawberries and my husband got the pancakes and omelette. The ladies seemed to be confused with what plate was ours. Not sure if they had the kitchen organized because they kept bringing us the wrong plate.

When we finally ate, my french toast was under cooked and soggy. You can't taste the cinnamon swirl that's in it and it didn't have any sweetness. The omelette my husband got barely had any chicken or mushroom and it was loaded with cream. Pancakes were dry.

We would have said something but no one came around to see how we were doing.

Got some coffee on a very busy day. Line out the door. I was looking for some honey to put in my joe and they didn't have any out front in the lobby. Roland (employee) asked what I was looking for and said they had some in the back but I said I was ok. Without me knowing he went in the back, got a to-go container of coffee and tracked me down on the street to give it to me. Will definitely give them my business next time in town. Roland is the man!

I love the basted eggs. Perfectly cooked every time. Great place to grab brunch and a drink before heading to an ASU game. It's a bit crowded on the weekends but the line moves quick and so does the food.

I had a friend in town this week, and we went a little overboard on the brats and schnitzels at a German restaurant the previous evening. Hoping for something healthy and light I decided to try NCounter. It was just what we were looking for. Good simple sandwiches (I had a tuna melt, she had a portabella sandwich) with a nice fresh side salad. The bloody mary was spot on, and the Americano was pretty solid as well. Other customers were tearing into some good looking French toast and eggs Benedict, so now I'm super psyched to come back for breakfast.

I wasn't particularly impressed with Ncounter. I had the Killer breakfast sandwich and my husband got the Eggs Benedict. Both were just alright, and not really that tasty. The tomatoes in my sandwich were sliced very thick, which would have been fine if they had any flavor. The ham in the Benedict tasted kind of weird to me, and the hollandaise sauce was extremely bland. The potatoes that came with it though were very tasty though. I also got a peach Bellini, which was not that great. I don't think they used high quality peach nectar. I did like that it came with a gummy peach ring as garnish though. There was also a mix up with food, and long after everyone else in our party had their food, mine was still no where to be found. Eventually I got up and found a manager, and my food came out shortly after. Overall, there are many better places to have brunch and I doubt I'll be back.

My advice is go for specialty items or make it at home  and this is why. Unfortunately, I can't give many stars for my experience today at this restaurant. I ordered the plain and simple. I just wanted basic breakfast. I was very disappointed. The bacon was cold and chewy. The Bagel was hard and cold. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and requested another bagel it was obviously black and still they served it. The poached eggs were perfect. The fresh squeezed orange juice was sitting in a cooler you have to stir it and it was okay just wonder how long it was there. The coffee was okay from the Roasterie down the street so it was stated. Yelp followers  gave so many stars I had to try this but unfortunately my experience wasn't great.  It seems like the specialty items if you're going to try this restaurant are the ones to try.  Well service is lackluster. The servers act like you're an inconvenience. The initial cashier who was training someone never made any suggestions when I told them this was my first experience there and just kind of stood there waiting for me to figure out the menu as opposed to just good customer service and selling it was as if they were just in a cryo freeze until I saw them out with verbiage. I offered to pay for my juice coffee and eggs yet the manager said no it's on us and we hope you come back and try it again. If they place the same type of emphasis on customer service with the wait staff as they do the manager it might have been a positive experience.

I always passed this place and thought, Man! It seems like it's only a sit-down breakfast restaurant. Whoa, completely wrong.

NCounter is just a solid sandwich and salad cafe (correction: it does actually serve breakfast food like omelets and all that jazz) that brings your food to your table. The flavors are great and not too overdone. When I went I had a sandwich (forgot the name) and I was extremely impressed by how tasty it was. And the price? Honestly, I've paid about the same amount of money--if not more--on crappier restaurants down the street, but none of those dishes could ever compare to NCounter's sandwiches/salads! 

If I had time to go back here, I would. Seems like this place is always busy, though, and with a limited amount of time for lunch, I can only enjoy this place once in a while. So sad!

This place is delicious. It's located super close to the university so lots of college students come here. It's generally super crowded but the lines go through fairly quickly and the food comes out quickly as well.
I'm vegetarian so I always grab the Farmer's Benedict with no meat and I absolutely love it. One of my favorite breakfast places in Arizona, especially Tempe. Highly recommended!

Love Ncounter! They have breakfast to die for and I love their coffee brew. They have a large menu so there is a lot to pick from and we don't get tired of it. I also appreciate that their atmosphere is more casual, because we like to stop by after morning hikes or bike rides. They are usually VERY busy which would be my only complaint. We have come here in the morning on weekdays and weekends at varying times and we can never seem to find a "slow" time for NCounter. So if it is busy, it is tricky to find seating.

This a a new trendy place in the mill ave district. Breakfast here is delicious, although the portions are on the smaller side so if you're starving it might not be the best choice. 

Tip: best bloody Mary I've ever had.

We have been waiting for our food for over 90 mins! The table next to us turned 2 times. While the food looks good, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless you are ok wasting half a day to get a waffle.

I went for brunch for two times, and really enjoyed their food and seating.  Omelets are so good. If the weather is not so hot, you can just sit outside chilling with your friends by the street side. Now whenever i feel like a brunch, Ncounter just pops up in my head. Love it!

We went for the first time, and enjoyed the pre-busy hours (7am) and enjoyed their shady patio. I had the farmer's market bene. It was beautiful, and I really appreciated the big helping of vegetables. The hollandaise was great. The bad: the muffin wasn't toasted, which left the entire dish soggy. Also, the eggs were way under-poached, so the whites were really runny and hard to eat. Overall, very mushy dish. Good enough to go back, though.

Sweet baby Jesus I love this place. I understand it gets really packed and the servers and bartenders have a lot on their plate, but they're always on top of it and friendly. I've been here many times, and was convinced by my two favors bartenders, Peter and Tim, (Colton's pretty cool too) to write a review. Ncounter has the best omelette and their potatoes are ridiculously tasty. I've brought both my parents here and they loved it. They make great drinks and great food. I see some of these reviews that have negative feedback and I feel that it had just been a bad day for the restaurant. But honestly who doesn't have bad days?! I love Ncounter and it will forever be my favorite place. Ever.

I love this place. Quality of food is excellent, staff is friendly and attractive, price to value is spot on. The set up to order is crowded, but it's quick even when line is "long". Really just a great fast-casual concept for breakfast or lunch, and they kill it just right every time I've been there. Well done!

While there are tons of great choices on their menu, my fave will always remain the Natie Bomb Sandwich (smoked bacon, turkey, apple, caramelized onions, sundried tomato mayo, cheddar cheese, on grilled 12 grain bread). Heads up, they're only open from 7:00 AM - 3:05 PM.

The ambiance was refreshing.  Mimosas were perfect and very tasty.  The food was so good and tasty.  Loved having a mimosa with my brunch after a small hike! I'm visiting from out of town and would definitely want to come back again!
First time to eat at this place and it was very good! The french toast and waffle were delicious especially the honey butter that comes with it! Don't forget the sausages as well!

Friendly staff, good food and overall a nice place. Granola was really good with decent but not amazing fruit. The French toast was very sweet but good. The OJ was fresh and good. Great outdoor seating and parking was easy. Worth going...

It's the best thing on Mill Ave in terms of food.

Made a date with some girlfriends to have brunch here on a rainy Saturday. I knew that was a stretch because of NCounter's popularity that we'd get a table at the brunch hour on a Saturday. But luckily, we got a table and we actually sat outside under a space heater and it was just fine. The inside is so modern. We went in December and their Christmas decorations were super cute. We stood in a line that wasn't too long but long enough that I had time to drool over the baked goods window. Mini cupcakes? Damn cutest things I'v ever seen. I ordered the Saturday special which was a plate of biscuits and gravy (I'm a simply gal) and my girlfriends order the much-raved about eggs benedict and an omlette. Let me tell you, for not being a fancy sit down brunch place, that was the best looking omletter I have ever seen. 

The bs and gs were great and I got a chocolate milk which totaled to $12.50. Meh, a little overpriced. I have to give NCounter props though, they sell their own merechandise and the branding they have going on is very cool and hip. Plus they have seating everywhere. I'm certain had it been a nice day out the place would have been packed to the rafters.

Can't wait to go back!

Total disappointment! We came in hoping for a great breakfast in Phoenix and got a total disaster. We ordered our breakfast took the number just to find out that nobody took the number in the kitchen, 15 min later we were asking about our order and nobody new about it!! We were asked to show our receipt!!! a few minutes later our order was found packed in boxes to go and the waiter was trying to convince us to eat our breakfast in boxes in the restaurant. 
It's my first negative review in Yelp but I guess this is a part of the reason the app exist.
Customer service should be first, unfortunately we did not get a good service. 
We hope ncounter improve in that aspect.

Right at the top of the bustling college scene on Mill Ave. is this trendy Breakfast and Sandwich shop. I work down the street and had to check it out after inquiring about good eats in the neighborhood, the traffic it gets on a regular lunch hour is something to gawk at but the vibe is fitting for me and others who are familiar with the Northwest and the "Portlandia" mentality.

I had the Natie Bomb Sandwich, because on the website in the gallery section it caught my eye. What is there not to like...  "smoked bacon, turkey, apple, caramelized onions, cheddar cheese, on grilled 12 grain"

It was calling me... 

So, it despite the heavy amount of foot traffic, I found a place to sit outside and enjoy the sandwich with little effort, the turn over time is impressive as well. It is pressed before arrival and comes with a side of chips. If you are looking for comfort food this isn't really the place, but if your looking for creative takes on classics and a great place to just blend in and relax at a middle of the road price range. This place suits that need just fine.

I have been coming to this breakfast place for years and today I experienced the worst service I have received in quite some time at a restaurant. My girlfriend and I waited almost 30 minutes for a take out order. We quietly stood by the pickup counter patiently waiting and there were three associates that would periodically look over at us but didn't even bother to ask what we were waiting on. After 30 minutes go by I finally ask if our order is done and its over on the other side of the counter just waiting to be bagged up. Working in the kitchen I know it doesn't take thirty minutes to make eggs and the associates should have been courteous and asked what we had been waiting on. They bagged our food and handed it over to us with no sorry  or apologies . I am never coming back to this restaurant unfortunately and I will be sure to tell my friends. I hope that the manager reflects on this from a customer perspective.
Great food, good selection of breakfast. Fruit being surprisingly good options. Prices are great and Friendly staff makes this place a go to spot

SHADY EMPLOYEES! The food here is good, but the customer service I experienced was awful. I went this past Sunday and left my water bottle on the counter of the bar. I immediately called when I got home and realized I had left it, and the man that answered asked me to describe it and then confirmed that it was at the restaurant. He set it aside for me and asked me for my name and told me I could come pick it up. When I got there, I went to the counter and asked for the water bottle by name and someone went back to grab it, saying she had seen it there earlier. She returned saying that it wasn't there with no explanation, and was not willing to look any further. I like this place, and i'm bummed that one of their employees stole something that they said would be set aside safe.
I found a fly in my screwdriver. I drank it down and then pointed out the fly and got another drink 10/10 service.

I was excited to try this place, but I will not go back. The patio is awkward and loud because of the busy road it sits on. Umbrellas are not well placed so there's really not much cover for brunch. The food was boring and bland. Scrambled eggs had no salt or pepper in them. Pancakes were plain and syrup did not taste very maple-y. A little cinnamon or nutmeg would have gone a long way! The little mini cinnamon rolls were also not very good. They're brushed in cinnamon and sugar, but there isn't any mixed into the dough, so some bites have no flavor. Also, the pancakes come with syrup only for $6.50. If you want any toppings, they're $1.50 - each. Eggs on the side is another $3. Definitely not worth the price!

Breakfast or lunch this is your spot. 

For breakfast I recommend getting one of their delicious healthy omelets. The hot Juan is a personal favorite. But they also make one with avocado that is equally delicious. For lunch I highly recommend one to get the chopped salad, truly delicious especially the pesto dressing. For dessert pick from any of the delicious cookies or pastries at the counter. Enjoy a mimosa from the bar to help your hang over on Sunday.

Very trendy atmosphere. Inside can get crowded but there is usually room outside, and in the cooler weather the dining experience becomes quite favorable. Perfect spot for a late Sunday morning or any lunch date. Check it out!

Food is very good. My boyfriend and I went here on our trip to Tempe, AZ to have brunch and it was super good and the food came out very quick. We really liked it, so we came back for another quick breakfast the day we had to leave to go back home. The reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the EXTREMELY long wait we had the second time we ate. Food was still very good but it was almost triple the wait as our first time going!

While I love having a fancy dish at Essence, it's nice to finally have an option for an all-American style breakfast in Tempe that isn't IHOP.

Though often crowded on the weekends, the servers really do a great job of clearing off tables quickly, and checking in to make sure all is well with your dishes. I have been there over 10 times, and have never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a table to open up.

I think the only confusing aspect of the restaurant is how your food is ordered. A few times I have been waiting in line to order at the main registers, when servers at the secondary registers (next to the drink bar) have asked people behind me for their orders. It just feels weird to be standing ahead of someone in line, only to hear them get their order in before you. A couple times, it left me feeling as though NCounter wasn't well organized and a bit put off that my food wait time was increased even though I was ahead in line. That's the reason I have knocked off one star from my rating.

I just learned, though, that you can also order food online. My husband went to pickup an online order and showed up 5-6 minutes early to just be safe and the food was already packed up and waiting. I did wonder how long it had been sitting there before being picked up. Perhaps NCounter would do better if these online orders were 2 minutes late instead of 10 minutes early. Just a suggestion.

The food, though, is fantastic! My favorite items to order include:

* Eggs, Toast, and Grilled Potatoes ($5.50)--simple and tasty, make sure to ask for some extra jam!
* Classic Eggs Benedict ($8)--Delicious!
* French Toast ($5.50)
* The Pear Omelette ($8)--you can't beat this brie and bacon combination.

Such a shame these guys don't focus on the coffee as much as they do the food. 

Been there twice now cause the location was close to the hotel but being a real coffee lover,  sooooo disappointed to discover that they can't provide the usual gibraltars, flat whites, and machiatos we expect from cafes and restaurants now.

The first time my espresso came out in a 12 inch paper cup so virtually a dribble in a cup. The second time, when the waitress had no idea what a gibraltar was, I ordered a small Americano, only to have it taste like a weak french press. No crema, no strength,  no flavor.

Such a shame for the business to have invested in a commercial espresso machine only for them not to make the most of it.

This place is super yummy, the ingredients are so fresh and delicious and several menu items are interesting. I also loved the following random things: nuts are combined in to many dishes, the kid's menu was reasonably priced, and everyone working was pretty friendly. We were in town for about ten days and I easily had us visit five times. I definitely recommend!

Went on a late Saturday morning and found it to be a pretty big disappointment, especially after hearing this is the same people that run TC Eggingtons, which has never disappointed.  Their second week being open so I can understand the long ticket times (20 minutes for breakfast), but not the poorly cooked food.  English muffin on the Eggs Benedict was not even toasted, the potatoes were undercooked and lacked any seasoning.  They looked like they came out of a bag.  The bananas on the Banana Foster French Toast were uncooked and not caramelized with any brown sugar.  The French Toast itself was OK, but for $7 and no side it was pretty bad.  The bacon was cool and seemed to have been cooked off earlier and held in a steam pan like at a buffet.  The biggest nightmare was the setup.  I had no idea where to go as there are 3 entrances, none of which access the counter where you order.  You enter and walk through a maze of tables and people to order your food.  I thought I was in the right line and then realized it was people waiting for espresso.  Then when I got in the right line there were people all over the place and nobody knew who was next.  Was there no thought or planning involved in this style of service to handle busy times?  Sauce & Pei Wei seem to have it nailed, maybe they should take a lesson or two from them.  Second star because they offer breakfast cocktails, unfortunately we will not be back anytime soon to try them.

nice breakfast place on mill. stand in line, order at the counter and they bring your food to the table. omelette with pears, havarti, sliced almonds and bits of bacon was good and cheesy. it had a fresh fruit cup as accompaniment. weather perfect and nice to sit out side. fortunately no one was smoking.

Great omelette, friendly & pretty staff, good espresso, solid music.. and the worst home fries I've ever had. cut up a potato into little slices, lightly heat it up in a pan so it's a little soggy and not crispy, don't add any spices or garlic or anything... nope.
The wait sucks. Waited over half an hour on our food and people up to three orders behind us recieved food before us.
This Breakfast and Brunch place is really fresh and delicious. There is a really nice outdoor patio to enjoy Arizona's Spring weather.

Took my parents that were in town from Chicago to Ncounter and our omelett, french toast, and potatoes were cold and soggy. We ordered at 10:50am and received our meals at 11:20am.. 30 minutes to make a few meals? The only warm part of our meals was the syrup. Very upsetting considering nobody apologized for the delay...You'd think a restaurant would have one or the other, great food or customer service, if not both! Today Ncounter lacked both.

This place is very diffrent for mill! Breakfast is great tast like home not like a fast meal! worth the $$$ the evern have green juices 

but the parking SUCKS thats why we stopped going we had to pay to park then eat?  no thanks

I came across Ncounter because it was one of the only open restaurants in the area I was traveling through that was open before 10 o'clock-- and I'm happy I found it! 
I ordered the Portobellini hot sandwich that was filled with artichoke, spinach, portobellini mushrooms and roasted red peppers on ciabatta bread. I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor that wasn't lost due to eliminating the provolone cheese and balsamic mayo to make the item vegan. The sandwich came with chips and was easily shareable, but I was hungry and ate it all! If ever in the area I would recommend trying this restaurant, and their Bloody Mary's (great variety).

Perfect fit on Mill Ave. I'm surprised it took this long to get a cool little breakfast/coffee bar on Mill, considering the amount of hangover breakfast traffic the area gets with ASU right next door. 

I've been a few times and have been rather pleased. The food has been great, and they do a nice job with their presentation which gives the experience that extra bonus. The atmosphere is engaging, artwork on the walls, some cool old architectural sketches, and some nice color highlights and tasteful touches. The coffee was fine, nothing amazing but by no means sub-par. I honestly opt for the smoothies when making my breakfast trips, I take care of the coffee at home before hand. 

Only complaint: when it gets busy things tend to fall apart. I've been there a good handful of times now and they are definitely gaining momentum. The only problem is when it gets out of hand and the line is out the door, food takes a while and sometimes comes looking rushed or even cold. Honest mistake though, it gets pretty packed in there. 

Overall: perfect breakfast spot for a late start on a Saturday. Conveniently located next to a light rail stop as well.

The best sandwich shop in the city.  Wonderful, creative combinations of ingredients.  Great salads.  Fantastic breakfast items served all day.  Cool, hip atmosphere.  Three days in a row now.  My new favorite lunch spot.

Thank you to Yelp again - we found this great spot so close to the hotel we could walk.  The line was out the door but moved quickly.  The cashier was nice and answered all my questions. Everyone was happy - bloody marys, specialty coffees, great breakfast items.  We will return the next time we are in Tempe.

I've never been to the actual building, but a girl brought half a dozen of these to my BIL when he was visiting. Some of the most BEAUTIFUL cupcakes I've ever seen; but also some of the most disgusting. Too dry and the frosting was way too sugary. If they hadn't been a gift none of us would have touched them.

Messed up the order, skipped a menu item, and the chicken cilantro soup was absolute trash. Honestly, it is hard to mess up a simple order or a soup. The soup had too much tomato base, and the chicken fasted funky. After they messed up the omelette, I asked them to correct it, and even though the omelette plate had bread with it, she brought "repaired" omelette without bread. Seriously?!! First you mess up the order, and then you don't even have decency to bring full order again. After I asked her to bring the bread, it was COLD!. Extremely disappointed. 

The only extra star, they got, was for good tasting omlette.
Best breakfast in Tempe! (Almost tied with Chompies but Ncounter wins out for healthiness!)
my favorite salad EVER happens to be served at Ncounter. It's the chopped salad...goodness gracious every bite is better than the previous. Try it!

Place was busy on a Saturday morning but luckily there is tons of seating. Line moved quick and food came in a decent amount of time. Employees were friendly and cleaned plates quickly after we finished. Good prices and the only breakfast joint on mill so I was happy it wasn't disappointing. I would definitely go back. Plenty of interesting food options to try.

This place is new, and its amazing! On my first time, I order the dripping cheddar, roast beef sandwich... BLEW MY MIND AWAY!
Second time visiting, I ordered the Farmer's Market Bene, and I was sad once I was almost done ravishing it! 
closes at 3pm, everyday, which annoys me, because sometimes I need a late a lunch, or an early dinner while on campus  :(

After eating at Ncounter for lunch and Breakfast, I think they have a winner. Staff is helpfull, eggs were cooked perfectly, and the decor is great. We love to support a new local business that is not a chain! Good work! We will be back.
The Mediterranean omelette is my personal favorite menu item. This place is delicious; however they close inconveniently early and it's always crowded.

Delicious!  You've got to try the cinnamon French toast - you can add it a-la-carte. 

Everything is great!

My first review for Ncounter was regarding a lunch dish, and I was not impressed.  

I have since been back several times for breakfast and had much better experiences.  Their breakfast dishes are on point!  The Chipotle Egg Burrito and Classic Eggs Benedict are my favs.  The grilled potatoes they serve with most breakfast dishes are perfect.  Every time.

This looked cool so we tried it.  
Waitstaff were not very friendly. 
Tuna melt was AWFUL,  very gooey with no noticeable tuna.  
Iced tea tasted like dirt.

My wife and I were in Tempe visiting Tempe. We stopped in for breakfast. My wife ordered a veggie style omelet that came with hash browns. She liked the omelet but the potatoes were very blah. They were not crispy and were under seasoned. My dish was a ham, egg and cheese open faced dish. It was very tasty. Overall it was enjoyable.

This place is a joke. Another overpriced fake establishment going for trendiness over quality. My muffin had no flavor other than the undercooked bits of apple that still had the peel on. The coffee was ruined by the non-dairy creamer that was NOT labeled as non-dairy. For a place to have only two pitchers, one of which is 2% milk and the other non-dairy creamer not labeled as such, is unforgiveable. I ordered regular coffee; I knew upon seeing their super-auto poseur espresso machine to avoid any espresso drinks. I also haven't tried their cooked food, but judging by the prices, I don't think I will.  $8 or more for a sandwich is more expensive than Romancing the Bean and most items at Essence Bakery, and it's unlikely to be as good as either. If you want a muffin, walk across the street to Romancing the Bean (located at the base of the KPMG building), if you want good coffee or a croissant, get one of the best ones in the state at Essence (Hardy & University), and if you want an awesome breakfast or lunch, try either. For espresso you'll have to go Cartel Coffee. It's the only good place within a mile of Mill Ave. Whatever you do, don't waste your time or money on NCounter.

I'm conflicted. I've been here before and enjoyed it, but took a friend there this morning and was pretty disappointed. Gave the friend the big build-up so was a bit embarrassed by the poor showing. 

We ordered 2 Plain and Simples and they showed up pretty quickly. So far so good. However, the food was not hot, the bacon was undercooked and the potatoes were way overcooked. Not sure how the potatoes were overcooked, and still served at room temperature - but that's how it was. To cap off my experience, I found a long hair on my plate. I'm not squeamish, but I gotta say, "yuk."

Restaurant 101: Someone needs to scrutinize every plate before it leaves the kitchen. Is the food hot? Is there a big friggin' hair in it? 

We were the first customers on a Sunday morning, the cooks were probably hung-over college kids. 

Oh, and while I'm at it - the coffee was weak and nearly devoid of flavor.

I'll be downtown in a few weeks, so will try it again and revisit / revise this review in the interest of fairness.

UPDATE: Went back a few weeks later, and it seemed to be back to it's usual quality. Would probably go again.
First time visiting food is amazing fresh many choices (healthy) - delicious. great service, a must try
Cute little place with wonderful service from the moment we walked in on a Sunday.  Interesting & tasty cocktails to start.  Speedy service and chill atmosphere.  Would recommend as a quick treat!
I worked here, and the food is amazing. Everything on the menu is a good choice!

Best and busiest brunch spot on Mill! Just be warned if you go on the weekends, it's a mad house. But overall they serve great food plus they are close to A mountain so you can burn off your meal after!

Seems like a typical breakfast place just with more hipness and cool sheep artwork. I got the pear omelette which was a nice sweet and savory taste and my husband got the chipotle burrito. They came with a side of not so fresh potatoes but they had nice flavor. The bathrooms are cool and so was the music. Overall, it was slightly unique breakfast food but didn't go the extra mile to make it healthy or less sugar less saturated fatty breakfast.

We rode our bikes down to NCounter on Saturday for lunch. I now have a new favorite breakfast/lunch spot! The menu was great ( breakfast, salads, sandwiches) and the ambiance was fun.  I had a delicious sandwich and my wife had an omelet. Both were very tasty and well prepared.  Next time I plan to try some of the delicious pastries at the counter. Cinnamon Pecan roll looks great. Definitely headed back.

I love this place!  I have not had one bad dish here.  This is finally a place on Mill Ave that will make it.  I highly recommend the Portobellini sandwich and the Banana Fosters French Toast.  They also serve Bellinis and Mimosas!

The reviews are pretty accurate. There's great food and it's made very well. The only downside to this place is the wait time. If you go for brunch on the weekend expect to be waiting on your food for a while. It's worth it most times.

Ate brunch around 11am, almost no wait in line. Food came prompt, we ordered coffee,the iced quad latte is pretty tasty by the way. Had the loaded omelet with tomatoes as the side, and it was easily the best omelet I've had in years. Girlfriend had the Chipotle burrito, minus the spicy sauce which they easily accomodated. TL;DR Short wait outside normal busy times, great food. Come here!

Great menu...lots of choices and excellent quality and tasty food. Long line went pretty quick but need to redesign the ordering area to accommodate that many people. We all enjoyed are meals and good vibe...will definitely return.

I'm get my breakfast to-go here about 2 times a week. The omelettes are fantastic, and they fill you up for hours.
I'd recommend this place for sure, just beware, the lines are long for a reason so plan a head.
Excellent food, good variety, friendly staff, outdoor seating. Chipotle burrito was great.

I ate here once and it was great. The second time was for my Birthday and the food was extremely unsatisfactory. I ordered a Eggs Benedict and the eggs were literally over cooked to the point the yolk was like a hard boiled egg. The yolks should have some liquid texture to them on an eggs Benedict not be hard. Aside from that the rest of it was not cooked well either and I paid over $20 for just my meal. I reached out to the location (Tempe Mill Ave) and they not so much as reached back out to acknowledge they received my feedback. I will never return here for the simple fact that they showed no concern for the customer experience or concerns.
If you ever need a bathroom in a pinch. Please. Go to encounter. The experience will change your life
Great place for lunch food! Accomodating staff and very organized service- we will be back!!
the bananas foster was delicious!!! yummmm And if you don't want something sweet the Hot Juan Omlete and  the Loaded Omlete was absolutely delish!

I've been waiting to try this place until ASU was out for the summer. It was still busy at 9:30 on Saturday but I'm sure less so than during the school year and we were even able to find free street parking nearby. Customers looked like mostly locals in a mix of ages.  After ordering at the counter it took about 15 minutes to receive our food. Service was brisk and efficient and we enjoyed watching the food orders come out.  I had "The Killer" breakfast sandwich (bacon, tomato, blue cheese and eggs on toasted ciabatta) with fruit on the side and my husband had chorizo and potatoes with toast instead of tortillas. Both were excellent.  I'm glad to see they're opening new locations because I'd hesitate going to this one during the school year unless it was pretty early in the day.
Found the place while on a bike ride. The breakfast was awesome for the price would highly recommend.

Stopped her for brunch on a Mon before my drive back to Tucson. Honestly, I wasnt too impressed. I ordered the Classic Eggs Bene & a strawberry banana smoothie. The smoothie was average & the eggs bene took forever to come. When my food did finally come. it was a bit cold. The potatoes were bland and my eggs bene were average at best. The egg was poached well and the yolk was runny, but the english muffin & ham were a bit tough.

We have eaten several times for breakfast only.  I usually order a breakfast sand which and have been pleased.  Today I ordered the hot Juan omelette and was disappointed.   Way to much cheese which led to the omelette sitting in a lot of grease.  Way to little chorizo and way to much salsa.  The omelette was drowning in salsa.  My MIL had French toast that was cold.  My d got pancakes and enjoyed those.  They were good.  

I will also agree with the poster below that the music is a tad to loud at breakfast.  When you continually have to say what it is to loud.
Great food, moderately priced.  Also, conveniently located off the light rail in Tempe

Breakfast is the most important meal of the day!!  

I normally always order the same meal, eggs benedict & the potatoes are my favorite. Yes the restaurant is usually busy inside and outside seating, I normally try to order my food-to-go. So if you decide to come in, be there early or be ready to wait a few moments till a table clears up. I think another location is needed near Chandler, Az area-- just sayin.....

My group of four went to NCounter for brunch on Saturday. I had the Bono sandwich, which also comes with a side salad. It was extremely delicious. The others had French toast and omelettes, and they liked their meals very much.

The service and ambiance are great. The only downside is that it can feel a bit cramped inside.
Sadly disappointed with the quality of food. We spent $21 for two entr√©es and it was really only worth about $8. The potatoes, eggs and bread were underdone

The loaded omelette and Pecos grill are what my husband and I ordered. Our friend ordered eggs Benedict. She gave her order a three star, we gave ours a four. Our potatoes were warm, not hot. 

The flavor of our meals were really good, but it would have been nice to eat a hot meal. 

Overall, I would come back, despite the temperature.
Great place to get a top quality breakfast.. Pear omelet is awesome! Great coffee too.

First time here! A friend who is an ASU alumni suggested it as we were headed back to Scottsdale from the airport. Quick service, lots of options and bartender was super nice!! Had the farmers market Benedict, only downfall was it wasn't very warm (nit sure if that was intentional) and there was no ham on it... But the Bellini and mimosas were excellent! Especially with the peach ring candy garnish!

Went here for breakfast on a Thursday morning. Asked where our order was after waiting 30 minutes to be told it would be another 20-40 minutes b/c they were having a burrito special and were running behind. We were not informed of this when ordering. Ended up getting a refund and leaving.

While the food here was good, I am just not a fan of the long line, the packed atmosphere, and the tight quarters. Just don't feel like I had any personal space, and made me feel a bit stressed out, and rushed. I would suggest coming here for breakfast, however I highly recommend to avoid the busy hours.

I've been here twice and both times were AMAZING!  I got omelets both times, once with a side of waffles.  My husband got sandwiches both times (not a breakfast man).  We both have agreed that this is one of the best brunch joints around.  It's a little pricey but very worth the occasional visit!  Service was quick both times as well, even though we went during very busy Saturdays.  I think we maybe waited 10 minutes after ordering despite the place being packed.
Anyone who lives in Tempe knows this place is the best. I live right on mill and have rolled in here hungover many times, and their breakfast and bloody marys always suffice.

Their Banana Walnut Pancakes are to die for ....I can have them every single day of my life...they are that freaking delicious.They also have a variety of healthy sandwiches and fruit juices...perfect place for Breakfast / Brunch.Be prepared for a wait time though..they are pretty busy..

The croquet monsieur is divine! It's also portioned very well and the sour dough is to-die for! The pricing is a bit high, but the food quality absolutely matches that.

As for the seating: it's OK! You know, it's on Mill Ave (which is so mehhh) so they work with what they were given as far as the building/setup is concerned. It's always so packed BECAUSE the food is so great! If you can find a way to fix the way the seating goes (inside and out) to make it less cramped when it's hopping, you will get a 5 star rating from me. But other than that--kudos! For bringing a nice, divey breakfast joint to a trashy, bar street for ASU and young drunkards alike!

This place is pretty great if you want a quick brunch with a bunch of college students. It is your typical run of the mill (pun intended) college brunch spot with loud music. I love the patio area and the quick service they offer. We got our smoothies and food really quick and were greeted by friendly staff. The blueberry smoothie is worth going back for, but the biscuits and gravy were lack luster. They need some more flavor, the gravy had no wow factor and honesty I ended up taking it off the biscuits to just eat them. The biscuits were good, however mine had some burnt spots I had to eat around. Worth checking out, but don't expect for anything out of this world. :)
This place was my first stop in AZ as soon as I got in from the airport. EVERYTHING IS DELICIOUS. I mean, you gotta love a place that has morning cocktails. AMIRITE?

Great food, service, & atmosphere! I love their Farmers Market Benedict, with avocado and breakfast potatoes, yum! They have a pet friendly patio but it is fast casual so you have to order at the counter, luckily they have a bar outside you can order food from too!

Wonderful wonderful!! Finally a place in downtown Tempe where I can get breakfast. I am an early riser ( 7:30 am on weekends!) and nothing is ever open that early. NCounter answered my prayers. I ordered the eggs Benedict with Canadian bacon. So delicious! It's really easy to make the hollandaise sauce too tart. So not the case here. It was very filling and I had the potatoes on the side. My boyfriend got the Pear omelette and it was sweet and salty, the perfect combination. For a drink I ordered an iced chai tea. Perfect! I have tasted iced chais that have tasted like soap before so I was pleasantly surprised when this didn't taste like it. Did you know they also serve breakfast cocktails?? That's right for only $5 bucks you can get a mimosa, Bellini, or bloody Mary. Most places charge like $7. It's within walking distance from my house and steps away from the light rail. Whether you are a meat eater or non meat eater there is bound to be an item that will satisfy your palette.

We had a great breakfast here. It is set up in a fast food fashion but the food is way better than you will ever find at any fast food place. Lots of college kids flock into this place so you know the foods great and the prices are right.

I had the pear omelette today and it was outstanding. Very different for an omelette but it works with just the right combo of ingredients. The staff was welcoming too. I took a star off for the lack of hash browns - maybe one day breakfast establishments will realize that breakfast potatoes aren't exciting. It's all about the hash browns well done.

Delicious lunch spot. I had the tuna melt and it was great. My girlfriend had the chopped salad. Also good. The menu is extensive. The breakfast items going by looked amazing. I'm going to have to come back and try their red velvet waffles!

Food was excellent. Service was good. Order at the counter and find a seat place. The set up is weird though since the counter is way in the back and hard to get to when it's busy. Hubs and I had the eggs Benedict which was good. Perfect poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. Daughter had bananas foster French toast. Like a cinnamon roll on steroids. Daughters friend had the Santa fe which was good too!
Love Ncounter in Tempe. Tried this new location and was disappointed in the amount of turkey in this sandwich, so thin. Not like the natie bomb I had in Tempe! I hope they make some corrections.

Ncounter features fresh food and an expansive menu.  The ingredients are local when available and the location and feel of the restaurant is top notch. More spicy food needed tho, even tho the hot sause collection is nice...  High three star rating. I recommend...

Best breakfast place in Tempe! The location right next to the Mill ave. light rail station makes it easily accessible to anyone coming from either the west or east valley. Make use of the light rail if you can park a couple stops away as parking is limited and almost always metered since it's downtown Tempe. There's always a good sized crowd no matter which day you go. The food options are plenty as they have something for everyone and is inexpensive as well. I often go for their omelette (Loaded is a favorite) with potatoes on the side. Their sandwiches are delicious as well. Nom nom nom.

Alright, I'm knocking this place down a ton. The last time I was in here our service wasn't great and I was completely disappointed with the food I ordered. My boyfriend and I stopped in one morning before catching a flight. We ordered two yogurt parfaits and a soy latte for me.

The latte was just fine, nothing special, and the girl helping me at the coffee bar was nice. The parfaits were mediocre. Ok, not good. I hate, repeat hate, when you order a yogurt parfait with "fresh fruit" and its packed full of melons. Yes, you know the sort. Cantaloupe, Honey Dew, and even grapes are no good in a parfait. Melons add zero flavor or texture to a parfait and frankly, its cheap. Ok, I'm being mean and I'm kind of sorry. But I'm kind of not. 

A killer parfait has rolled oats, honey, and some actual fresh berries like: Blueberries, Raspberries, Strawberries, Goji Berries, pomegranate seeds, etc... Something besides melon. I think you're picking up what I'm putting down.

I haven't even been served yet, in fact my boyfriend is still in line to order, but it is a very busy Sunday morning and yet an employee just brought out a big bowl of ice water for my dog as we wait on the patio. Automatically in love.

This place is chill. Service is dec. The food here is good but omg do girls love it here. Must remind them of being in LA. Every time I go I always get the over priced mill ave stack. Only thing I can grub on the menu after a heavy night of drinking. Their eggs are weird and obviously not cage free.
So Yum! Great Prices, especially for the amount of food you get! And the food is So Pretty!! Love it!

Place was very busy. Good was delish. 
Service was very good. 
We loved our pear omelette and chorizo saut√©e!
The employees were working hard. We'll comeback for sure.

Plain n Simple Breakfast is the way to go.  Plenty of food and great presentation.  Enjoy the breakfast with a cup of their coffee which is very good.  Place is bustling around 9 on a Saturday am.  Grab a table in the back corner if you want some quiet.

Never again! Car towed after a 45 minute wait!!! The food is very good. Great menu mix...its just that you really need to devote an hour and a half of your life to enjoy it. Not very conducive in a fast paced place like ASU/ Tempe.

Update on my previous review:

So disappointed!! They must have changed their cooks of something because I come here all the time (at least once a week) and the past two times I've been here it's been awful... 
My farmers Benedict was missing avocado and had un-ripe green tomatoes on it!! Ew.
Next, I came for lunch today... And it was bad. The Roma chicken sandwich was SOGGY! The bread was so filled with liquid by the time it hit my plate that it fell apart in my hands, landed/splashed on my plate, and got on my shirt... Very disappointed.

What happened Ncounter? You use to be so reliable and delicious :(

Order anything... it's all good. Seriously.

While Mill Avenue isn't exactly full of great breakfast spots, this one is about as good as it gets. From granola wheat germ to fried skillets, eggs benedict, chipotle burro, they have a ton of selections. Yeah, that's the hardest part of going here; selecting what to get. Oh, yeah... Don't forget to start off with a smoothie. If you have kids, ask for the Mickey Mouse pancakes, they will love them.

For lunch, the salads and sandwiches are equally as good. The cheese-freak in me is a fan of the "melt-down" and the "cheddar'd dip"

Ncounter is one of the most light rail friendly locations along the line. In fact, it's directly across from the light rail station at 3rd and Mill, you can't miss it. If driving, you can park in the garage just West of Ncounter or on Mill OR in the parking lot on the East side of the road.

Oh, they have beer, booze, coffee and pastries, too. Grab a coffee or try a bloody mary or a mimosa while sitting on the patio, you can't go wrong...
The red velvet cupcake really doesn't suck. My friend Bill ordered one once and I had to have a taste. Nothing says manly like two dudes sharing a red velvet cupcake, right?

My last few visits here are been sub-par.  I used to really love this place even though it's always crazy busy.  The last time two times I ordered the "Farmer's Market" the eggs were completely hard-boiled and it was served cold. With how busy they are, I am not sure how that happens. So I switched up to the "House Request" sandwich and there was about a 1/2 lb of cream cheese on it which is not very appetizing. After I scrapped most of it off it wasn't bad, but I had also obliterated the sandwich.  Maybe I have just had a run of bad luck so I'll stop by a few more times when I get time and see if it was just a run of bad luck.

This rating is for the one in Scottsdale after waiting and excited of its opening finally got to eat here
I would never come back
Food not great and coffee even worse.
The 1 Star is for the help which was the only good thing!!
Food really good. Went for breakfast and everything really good and prepared as requested. Nice selection and friendly staff. Will go again when in Phoenix

Been coming here for years, and I rave about the portobello sandwich like it's my grandmas recipe. Seriously, even though I am a breakfast food aficionado, portobello sandwich or bust. I love the location and that outdoor seating is perfect under the trees. The staff is nothing but friendly, and I've always received my food in a timely manner. I've not hit the bar too many times (which is honestly so rare for me) but they just have great iced tea.

This place was crazy busy the Sunday before ASU started classes.  Breakfast was awesome and the portions were decent.  Loaded Omlete was my choice.  My friend had the waffles.  Both were excellent.  The oatmeal looked good too, if you are looking to be healthy.  

I will come back.

*****Great breakfast spot on Mill!! :) 
I had one of their hot sandwiches the FOCACCIA ROMA-CHICKEN, cut up grilled chicken breast pieces, tomato, gooey melted provolone cheese, light mayo on a cheesy Focaccia bread with added minced jalapenos and lettuce to mine!!  It was delicious!! I also ordered my favorite drink the Caramel Macchiato, but instead they mistakenly made me a caramel latte which was still as good as a Caramel Macchiato. Overall, the service was great and so was my sandwich and drink!!
    *I will surely be back!! :)

GREAT food, GREAT atmosphere, decent prices, subpar service. Every time I've been here (about 5 times or so) I've loved the food, but the service is always pretty bad. Never a smile or a "have a good one" or even a greeting. Seems they do the minimum of taking your order and that's it.. It's a shame because this place could be amazing if they just put a little effort into customer service. It would totally earn 5 stars.

If you're simply lookin for amazing breakfast food then no doubt come here.

Good -- Omelettes, sandwiches, salads, pancakes -- fresh, creative, well presented.

Excellent customer service.

Bad -- Potatoes, acoustics (can't hear the person across the table)

Very bad -- Coffee, which is watery. Even the espresso drinks are weak and flavorless.

I love coming into N-Counter for brunch on the weekends. The food is great and there are a lot of menu options to choose from. I have only tried the poached eggs dish and the scrabbled eggs with potatoes, toast, and bacon. Both dishes are great and simple. I am excited to go back and try something a little more adventurous on the menu the next time I am in town. 

I have been to a couple other breakfast spots on Mill Ave and N-Counter is by far the best. They have a great menu to choose from, a bar with decent drinks, speedy service, and a beautiful interior. You walk in and place your order at the counter, so this is not a traditional sit down restaurant. I would suggest having someone in your dining party grab a table while someone else places the order.

Tip: I would highly recommend trying the Arizona Gunslinger hot sauce they have. It is awesome!

I'm a huge breakfast fan.  Imagine my delight when my husband and I discovered that a new breakfast/lunch joint had opened right off Mayo Blvd. A few years back we had visited the Ncounter in Tempe, but only for a quick mimosa. On our visit to the new Scottsdale location we both opted for the saute breakfasts, which are grilled potatoes topped with sauted vegetables and two fried eggs.  My husband had the Santa Fe Saute which included chicken, pepper-spiced veggies, mushrooms, and melted cheese with flour tortilla and I had the Denver Saute which had ham, green pepper, onions, grilled potatoes, and melted cheese with a choice of toast. Both were delicious! We also ordered mimosas because what is brunch without booze - just a sad breakfast. Though not the least expensive mimosas ($8), the pour was a good size and there were four different flavor options.  

Be prepared to order at the counter when you arrive and then find an open table.  It wasn't busy because we were there on a Monday morning so I'm wondering how easy/difficult it will be to find a table on a weekend.  This location has a very nice patio which should help during the warm weather.  The decor was clean and modern, the service was prompt, all in all a great experience. We'll definitely be adding Ncounter to our list of favorite breakfast places along with Snooze, the Breakfast Club, and the Hash Kitchen.
Great food and great selection- must come!

Great breakfast experience. Came at 8:00 on a Tuesday morning, so predictably there were plenty of seats and no wait.

You order at the counter and the staff will bring your meal to your table. Coffee, utensils, condiments, etc. are self service. 

Quick note:  Staff were all very friendly and attentive. It seemed as though the cared, and enjoyed their jobs. Well done. 

I had the Farmers Market, essentially a vegetarian eggs Benny. Quite tasty and good portions. The only negative with my meal was that one of my eggs was poached hard, the other very runny. Not sure how this happens, but no big deal. Variety is the spice of life, they say, and ncounter is no exception it seems.  A bit of Cholula hot sauce and I was good to go. 

Street parking was plentiful. 

I wouldn't hesitate to return during my next Tempe visit, and would confidently refer others.

We stopped by this restaurant to grab a sandwich to-go. I got the Pecos Grille which I enjoyed. The chicken was seasoned really well & tasted great with the cheese & jalape√±os. The only thing that was kind of weird was that the bread was buttered & warmed but not really toasted. If I order this again, I'd ask them to grill it or something.

The service was disappointing. When I placed my order, the lady at the cash register was rude & didn't listen to my order completely. I had asked for extra chips but didn't receive them .. I didn't bother to go back to the same lady but rather asked someone else for them.

Just for the food, I'd definitely go back.

If it was not too bad, And nothing spectacular then what .... 3 stars. Counter service and then table delivery. Food was presented well but just flat. Salad on the side was nice but lettuce was lifeless. Sauce on chiliquilles was meh. Friends eggs Benedict was also meh. The cinnamon roll was pretty yummy coffee was also nice. All in all not saying I wouldn't recommend it however in this part of town need to bring your A game.
