They have both outdoor and indoor sitting. They ran out of americanos ? or they only had coffee at that time ...

Mother's Day was a bad day to take friends. But everyone enjoyed their food. The wait wasn't as long for a table (considering like vultures we scoped out any where there was a family finishing up).  Everyone is always helpful and friendly. I can only say that this time my meal was slightly cold. I won't hold it against them, and not come back because previous visits have always been exceptional.

Great breakfast options and the help yourself coffee keeps you wide awake as you wait for your food.  This is not a quick Panera or Corner Bakery stop.  The food is very good, but it takes a while to make.  My standard benedict was pretty good and my daughter loved the HUGE fluffy choc chip pancakes.
My only issue is the lack of free parking and for that matter available parking on busy mornings.  Aside from those issues, the food is excellent and worth a visit!

This place makes me happy and has a little spot in my tummy. Located in downtown Tempe at the heart of it all Mill Ave this place is usually packed. I'm not going to go into all the reasons I enjoy this place there are too many but I will highlight a few things (1) You can order online and come pick it up (2) They have a great outdoor patio. My recommendations 

Breakfast- grilled wheat germ granola
Sandwich Hot- Portobellini
Sandwich Cold- smokehouse avocado stack
Salad- Original Chop (My FAVORITE SALAD) the presentation is colorful and beautiful, taste is scrumptious, and pesto dressing is amazing 

Only downfall is it closes at 3pm too early for me.

Breakfast!!! 

 It was crazy busy the morning me and another Yelper went to NCounter.  Long line so I was told to order at the bar, still a long wait, actually I think it was longer...therefore just stay in the line.  

I could've eaten the french toast AND Ncounter's Farmer's Market bene (2 eggs poached, spinach, tomato, avocado, hollandaise sauce and potatoes). Delicious!  The Farmer's Market bene that is!  I will have to go back for the french toast.  I also had ordered a mimosa.  More alcohol please next time.
This is my fav breakfast place on Mill avenue. High quality fresh food.

Came here since we were in Tempe down the street from Mill.

It has a trendy atmosphere; clean, cement floors, wooden tables, bare but with large, interesting art pieces. Inside was spacious and clean. Service was friendly. You order at a counter, seat yourself, and they'll bring your food out when it's ready.

We both ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict. Both meals were wonderful. Thick slices of ham, eggs cooked perfectly, and the hollandaise sauce was perfectly seasoned. Fried potatoes came with the eggs and they tasted so good they didn't need any seasoning or ketchup, etc...

Our experience was great! We'd definitely come back when we're nearby.

This place was absolutely phenomenal! Walking in, the place looked very inviting with a brightly lit open space and outdoor patio. I ordered the farmers market benny and a blueberry smoothie. The eggs benedict may be the best benny I have had so far and definitely competes with Butterfields and Butters, (places I frequent). The smoothie was also great, but after a look at the cocktail menu, I was wishing I had ordered a mimosa from their line of delicious looking mimosa choices! I will definitely be back! Highly recommend!

Lovely outdoor seating area, very dog friendly. Don't sit in the back of the outdoor seating area because it smells like propane back there. Had some coffee and just hung out for a couple of hours. It was a pleasant experience. Didn't order food this time but next time I will, because every dish that came by looked magnificent! All of the prices on the menu looked very reasonable for the portion.

This place is awesome and fast which is a big bonus for the Mill lunch crowd. I ordered at the counter and had my food within 10 minutes. The tropical Iced Tea was delicious and so was my salad. I ordered the Chop, it had arugula, cranberries, corn, feta, red pepper, chicken and couscous (loved the couscous) and a slightly sweet and creamy basil pesto dressing.

I felt so good about my healthy lunch I splurged and split a chocolate cupcake with Georgie. It was moist and not overly sweet, I detected a faint hint of coffee in the icing. 

I will definately be back..

I was very impressed with my meal here. I got the chop salad, which had nice, neat little rows of all the ingredients. There was a layer of lettuce on the bottom, with a row of corn, feta, chicken, cranberries, pecans, and whatever else was in it on top. I had the dressing on the side and mixed it all together and it worked out great. My friend had the chilaquiles which she always gets and she's Mexican, so I have a feeling they're pretty good here. She's a picky eater, lol. Overall it was fresh and healthy, so it hits the mark for me!

The low reviews so far are interesting. My husband and I stopped in for breakfast this past Saturday and had a great first visit! Were we just lucky? Or do the rest of you not know what the hell you're talking about? ;)

I had the Killer breakfast sandwich (minus bacon), with "almost" hard fried eggs, Gorgonzola (fav), and tomatoes on ciabatta. The almost hard is how I try to make eggs at home, so that was a personal plus. It was delicious, and the side of potatoes was freaking great. I'm not the hugest breakfast potatoes fan, but they were seasoned really well. My husband tried a spinach/avo/tomato benedict along with a single banana pancake. The pancake was crazy fluffy and not only topped with bananas, but they were packed inside as well. Super yum.

The iced coffee was delish, although $5 per seemed a little steep. All in all, this is a great addition to the area. Welcome north, Ncounter!
Nitro cold brew, decent croque madame was decent. Just passing through, it's a college kid day after place, nice ambiance.

We went for breakfast, and it was amazing!  The environment was cozy, modern, and friendly.  We ordered at the counter, and the food was brought to our table in about 10-15 minutes.  The food was totally amazing!!!  Perfect portion sizes, perfect prices, perfect taste!  I will definitely be going back!

Had the cheese omelette and added sausage to it. Ordered a side of oatmeal and a banana and strawberry smoothie. The omelette was good, the potatoes were delicious, the smoothie a little bitter and the oatmeal was just right. Overall, I liked the food. Definitely made with fresh ingredients. If I'm ever in town again, I'll try the pancakes. They look delicious!

This place is legit. Dog owners, they allow behaved beasts of all sizes on the patio. For me, this is the best selling point.

I've had a ton of dishes here, including pancakes, french toast, omelettes, sandwiches--probably 10+ meals. I've only come here for breakfast and I think they aren't open past the late afternoon.

How it works is you walk up to the counter, order your food, and pay/tip right away. They'll give you a metal table number and if you ordered a hot or alcoholic drink, they will attach a laundry clip to it so the bartender can find you more easily. I recommend their mimosa or bloody mary. Great iced and hot teas, as well. Come here before/after a walk on Tempe Town Lake.
They forgot about us :-(. This has happened several times before! People around that were after us have their food and I ordered the same thing!!! Very annoying!!

Ncounter has the feel of an upscale urban diner. You can get all the breakfast classics but with a show of respect for quality and well-balanced flavor. The prices are reasonable and the environment is casual and inviting, if not a little cramped. Why the 4 star? It was great but it was nothing to write home about. They've taken a good, solid concept (i.e. diner fare) and delivered on it.

This place is cute, lots of options. However it does advertise itself to be on the healthy side and I didn't think it was very healthy. I had the veggie omelet that was soaked in grease. 

-very very busy
-semi-self serve
-Lots of seating (inside and out)
-lots of college kids
-noisy
-good for groups
-great for people watching

I recently had breakfast here on a Saturday with my family.

There is a children's menu- it's just not posted on their menu board.

Delicious menu options- we were all happy with our food.

The food took a long time. A Really, really long time. It was very busy but I get hangry and hangriness leads to one less star.


One thing to note- there is only cold brew. I am not a fan of cold brew so I assumed if I ordered iced coffee that is what I was getting. I barely drank it because it's not my thing. No almond milk or non dairy creamer on the coffee fixins area- unless I missed it.

Great ambiance- I'd definitely go back.

Solid breakfast joint near DT Phoenix. I love the whole order first then grab a seat concept. (My personal preference, actually). I also love how employees still provide excellent service after you've ordered and paid. All in all, tasty food. Fresh interior decor. Chill vibes. A+ customer service. A solid 4 star Ncounter.

Right across the street from work so this was a breakfast option.

Pretty extensive menu for breakfast. I got the classic egg's benedict. Can't go wrong with this. Pretty filling. I was expecting fresh potatoes, but hey, the fried cubed ones work as well.

The co-workers enjoyed their omelettes as well.
Great food. Awesome gluten free breakfast choices including waffles and muffins. Must come again.

So i got banana foster french toast and i was really looking forward to loving it seems how everyone said it was good here on yelp. I dont know what french toast they had but mine was disgusting. The sauce was so slimey it didnt even stick to my french toast or soak in it just layed on top of it.. i LOVE Bananas foster and this was NOT bananas foster..

Not to be graphic here but the sauce was almost like snot. Slimey and wouldnt pull away from the fork. I had to cut it. Let me repeat. I had to CUT sauce.. 

I took it up with an employee who just seemed to not care and acted like i didnt know what i was saying.
I then took it to the front and asked for something else. The manager i believe exchanged my meal for something else. I ended up with the breakfast burrito and it was amazing. The potatos were also amazing. Would i be back? Its very unlikely.

Came here for brunch with friends for the Downtown Tempe Brunch Crawl, and it was very crowded. I don't think the food was anything too special.

SERVICE: SLOW. In their defense the place was pretty packed but all the dishes came out at separate times :( 

AMBIENCE: indoor and outdoor seating though be careful with outdoors because it is HOT in the summer and very few shaded areas 

FOOD: for the brunch crawl there were $3 bloody Mary's, $3 bloody Maria's, and $3 breakfast tacos. We got an assortment. The food was good but nothing huge to write home over and the tacos were tasty but nothing too special.

This place has great food & drinks but I wouldn't order an espresso / coffee drink again. The dirty chai latte I ordered tasted like pure syrup. I have a giant sweet tooth but this was disgustingly sweet. I couldn't taste any coffee flavor because the syrup was so overpowering. I couldn't even drink more than a few sips of it, what a waste of money! I would just stick to the alcoholic beverages next time because their barista services are lacking. Really disappointed

The decor is more of a fast casual however food was surprisingly good. I had the Huevos and Chorizo and it was very tasty. I tried my friends red velvet waffles was also especially good. Yummy! You order in the front and they take the food to the table.

The coffee was ok.

Perfect patio!! You can't go wrong with the Benedicts (we had one regular and one farmers') and Red Velvet Waffles! The coffee was good, the staff was friendly and the prices were reasonable. Well worth the 10 minute wait!
GR8 place for breakfast. Location, menu choices, and taste of food were all good. Costs was a little high for time of day, other than that would go back for the french toast and turkey sausage.
The best breakfast spot in tempe. Husband and I come for breakfast couple times a month. Food is always great service fast and friendly. Neat location on mill ave.

Went yesterday for the first time, and I had a really nice breakfast.  

Had the Farmer's Market, pretty much a play on egg's benedict but with avocado and spinach, so like egg's florentine with avocado? yeah?  The potatey's weren't piping hot, which doesn't bother me at all...I'd actually prefer them not to be.  It reminded me of my dad though, something he'd be all pissy about and want to send back to warm up....So if you're bringing a friend like that there, beware.  The potatoes were really good though, they weren't all greasy and diner tasting, they were as healthy as potatoes can get maybe? The farmer's market was awesome though, not greasy, really light, lots of flavor, and a pretty presentation.  The hollandiase sauce was the perfect consistently, not too thick, and definitely not too thin, and not drenched all over the place. The english muffin was the perfect texture..I hate when it's a hard muffin and you can't cut it, that's the worst. And lots of avocado... thank you!  People can be so stingy with the avocado....feelin' you guys! The farmer's market paired with my bellini, a cutie patio, my friends and the shins playing?  I'd say we did pretty good.





Speaking of my bellini, it was really refreshing, and mostly champagne...feelin' you again Ncounter/ bartender!  When it was dropped off she actually said, "lots of champagne in this one"...I was definitely not mad about that.  And what I thought was fruit inside of it, was actually a peach o ring, like that!  And I ate it at the end, definitely a champagne ring, new fav? 






My friends got the eggs benedict, the fruit and granola, some of their toast with their signature (not vignature...vig regulars what's up?) cinnamon apple jam? I think that's what type of jam it was..whatever type of jam, it was delish.  





My friends also really liked their food and the overall ambiance of a place seemingly reminiscent to LGO but over in the Tempe area.   Speaking of LGO...Ncounter's food I think is better than LGO's.  There are very few things at LGO that have blown my mind, it's just nice to go there, because it's super cute, a nice neighborhood, something for everyone, picnic tables...you know why we all like it.  Realistically I love going to LGO, because it's always a lovely time with my friends.  BUT I think Ncounter offered an awesome brunch with my friends, and the food was better.  







Ncounter will definitely be a new regs place for us... in fact I'll be back today? The salads that went by looked amazing.    






Last thing that needs to be said....GET THE PUMPKIN COOKIE.  Holy fricken mother, I think we all died and went to heaven eating that cookie.  I am not even kidding... if those were around me everyday...easily the fast track to morbid obesity.  This being said, you should defs give Ncounter a try.

Not a bad place for brunch! Suits well for college students because you seat yourself and order at the front then they bring the food out to you! I got the chipotle burrito, pear omelette, and strawberry waffles. All pretty good but nothing extravagant about it. 

Parking around University is not that great so I wouldn't recommend it to the normal foodie. Like I said, it's more for college students just roaming around campus and stuff

Modern places like this are in short supply in Tempe/Phx, so it is great for a quick brunch.

The best part is that the parking is right  next door and the service is not crappy. Thought 2 out of the 5 times they were late, probably cz they forgot about our order. Try the chicken Focaccia sandwich with salad, it is healthy anad filling. Love the French Toast as well as the Chicken salad as well. 

A good brunch option to check out in Tempe.

ABSOLUTLY AMAZING!!! I try to come here before every home game I attend. The food is great and so is the staff. They are incredibly accommodating and the best part is we can sit on the patio with our dog.

i like the home fries here!

they know how to make a proper eggs benedict!

Love this place for breakfast or lunch!!! Great vibe and staff!! It was perfect after a hike at A mountain as it is right there. Love the outside or inside seating as well as dog friendly restaurant!!! Ordered the steel cut oatmeal with fresh berries! So yummy!!

Came in today for breakfast with my family.  Arrived at 10:15.  Line wasn't very long and we were able to order within a few minutes.  However, we did not receive our food until 35 mins later - way too long.  My eggs and turkey sausage were cold.  Not happy - this place is not worth the wait.  Might have been okay if my food wasn't cold -yuk.

Gluten-free boyfriend and I come here frequently and love it. It's one of the few places we can both get breakfast in the area. 
Delicious food. 
Only downsides are that it is always packed and parking sucks, but that's Mill Ave.

Came here for breakfast on a weekday. Ordered the french toast with strawberries and the build your own breakfast sandwich. The french toast was fluffy, light, and very fulfilling! For the build your own sandwich, you have different options for types of meat, cheese, egg, bread, vegetables, and a side of your choice. I enjoyed my sandwich and loved being able to pick and choose from many options.

This place is self seating. When we got there at 9:30 am, there was no line and just a quick 10 min wait for the food. There's metered parking right in front of the restaurant. This was a good first experience and I'd definitely come back again.

Ncounter is the hip and happening place to be at lunchtime on Mill Ave. 

I had the chance to try this place a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised by the vast options on their menu and the quality of food. Everything on the menu looked enticing, but I ended up going with the bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado sandwich with a side salad. I placed my order and took my number to the table to wait for my yummy lunch to arrive. Once it finally did (it did take a while but they were slammed due to popular demand) my tastebuds jumped for joy with the flavors of a regular blt mixed with the egg salad (who would have thought?!?). The mixed green salad was nothing special, but it didn't need to be. Next time I won't be so healthy and I'll go with chips or something fried! Other menu items I'll be back to try will be their breakfasts...oh my goodness they sounded good. 

The environment at Ncounter is very busy, but it isn't overwhelming. Despite it being crowded they have a good system so that the ordering line goes quickly, there are clean tables and seats available for everyone, and the process is comfortable for all who walk in the door. The staff is very friendly and all seemed to be working hard to make everything run like clockwork. 

Ncounter is a top notch lunch or breakfast spot for anyone who wants a solid meal (with both inside he box and outside the box flavors) at a reasonable price. If you are hungry on Mill Ave give them a whirl!
Awesome breakfast joint, one of favorites in the valley. I drive from Gilbert to go here. Great prices and GREAT food.

We had to drop our roommate off at the airport so we just yelped places around.  So glad I came across this gem.  You order first then seat yourselves, didn't seem overcrowded which was awesome because seats popped open.  We got the omelette and chipotle bacon burrito.  

Omelette- I'm super pickey with eggs.. this was SO good! Everything from the eggs to cheese to veggies were perfect.  I got wheat bread which sometimes can be grainy and dry, it was super moist and tasted great with the omelette, couldnt be happier.  

Chipotle bacon burrito- Awesome burrito the chipotle sauce complimented the dish so well and the tortilla was so soft.  

A bit on the oily side but its ok, its breakfast! 

Definately want to come back to try the eggs benedict.
Great breakfast in a cute little spot. We sat on the patio since the weather was great. Place is a bit cramped but worth it. Loved that it's dog friendly.
Had the bananas foster French toast and it was excellent. Good coffee, cute place and staff was nice.

Very cool and hip place on mill avenue. I like that you can order at the counter and find your own seats after. 

The food is good and the presentation is even better. I was really impressed about how they presented it! I got the red velvet waffles and I was not disappointed! 

My only negative is that this place gets really crowded and it might be hard to find seats. I would avoid going here on a Sunday morning/afternoon.

I have been here twice for Saturday or Sunday brunch.  I really love the food here, and the fact that we don't have to wait for someone to serve us.  The patio is great and Dog friendly right on Mill ave.  Great people watching as well.  It's a bit crowded on the weekends though.
Causal atmosphere that is welcoming and good food that is organic and fairly healthy.

The food is amazing. Loved every bite of my fusion chicken salad and all my other lunch dates were more than pleased with their meals. Just dont be fooled by the "brunch" title. This isn't a cute little sit down where you can loyter for hours with girl friends. It's located right near ASU and so is pact with college students, super crowded-a bit like an upscale cafeteria. Nonetheless, very dainty and chill. Food is worth it I guess

The food came quick for a busy day. I ordered the chipotle egg burrito which was delicious! Disappointed in their salsa though, it was pretty horrible, tasted vaguely like marinara and was served hot?? They should change that. Luckily they had Cholula. Hubby got waffles- crispy and tasty.  The bacon was flimsy and fatty though, needed to be cooked longer. You could probably just order it crispy next time.

There turkey pesto sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. The atmosphere is really laid back. Went there for Easter and had some amazing banana foster french toast and their bacon was cooked to perfection. My sister said her yogurt granola was some of the best she has ever had.

Great little spot in Tempe with great patio views of the Hill and hot ASU girls walking by. I had the chorizo breakfast and it was really good and not as oily as most. Also the price is really good and under $8 for most plates. It is great concept even with the extreme busyness they had on a Sunday morning. I wish for breakfast spots were a hybrid sit down fast food spot. My friend says I need to come back for the farmers benedict so I will return.
You can't go wrong with the food here. It's always delicious. And you have to try the red velvet waffle.

This is going to be interesting. If it was only the look, I'd give it 4 stars for being beautiful. It's a fun-USA-Anywhere kinda place. I'd give it 5 stars except the blueberry muffins we had were so dry and forgettable. The coffee stands out - I asked- turns out its Cartel so that's a big plus.  (Shoutout to buddy and Cartel roaster, Daniel Noffsinger)
But this is going to be interesting. I saw OSB (muffins were better), Red Hut and recently People Pizza Pub Start and stall with the slick Tempe franchise feel. Roosevelt Row is so unique with an unique culture. But there are indeed hundreds of new people, unrelated to Roosevelt-Arts history moving downtown.  
Breakfast spot? 
Vovomina , Matt's Big Breakfast and Phoenix Public Market are within walking distance. 
RoRo not spoken here. So we'll see.

We were here for breakfast/brunch. The whole set up is confusing with people crowding by the counter with their heads up thinking of what to order. It's hard to grasp the menu on the fly and none of us ended up with meals we anticipated of having. The counter girl was conceding and not very helpful. Finally, after ordering, we got seated. The food came, but no utensils. By the time we got utensils, the food was cold. Service is below average, the food is average, ambiance is unremarkable.

I had lunch here about a year ago and finally got around to trying breakfast this weekend. When I arrived, the line looked really long, but it went surprisingly fast. I ordered the Hot Juan--an omelette with chorizo, cheese, and salsa, and my boyfriend ordered the blueberry pancakes with a side of sausage. My boyfriend also ordered a milk and was disappointed to find they don't actually serve you a glass of milk, but instead, they have those little Shamrock bottles. I went with the iced tea, and while the jasmine green tea was delicious, the passion tea tastes like Robutussin.

Our meal took about 20 minutes to come out. I think they might have lost our order because I notice people who sat after us got their orders first. Anywho, my omelette was good, but it was a bit too heavy on the cheese and salsa and didn't have enough chorizo. The side of potatoes that came with the omelette were amazing! I would definitely get those again. The blueberry pancakes and sausage were delicious, and even though I am a more savory breakfast person, I might order that next time.

The one thing I really disliked about breakfast is they had loud club type music playing the whole time. I know it's on Mill, but you would think they would make a different choice in music. And then in the midst of all the club music, some sad Bruno Mars song came on...it was weird.

I would have given this place 3 stars based on breakfast alone, but when I had lunch here, it was perfect! I highly recommend the Original Dagwood- turkey sandwich with havarti. The vibe was also a lot more relaxed at lunch (aka I didn't feel like I was at a club).
Great food! Only downside is that it is always busy! It can be challenging to get a table, but worth the wait if you have the time.

I went here on a Sunday early afternoon which I knew going in would be the busiest time to be in there so I kind of braced myself for that. So I wasn't too shocked to show up and find it to be a madhouse, they definitely have put as many tables as possible in here. I feel at some point if a place gets this busy they need to find a way to better secure tables for people who are actually eating their food. I watched at least 4 tables be taken by people who just wandered in off the street and didn't order a thing. 

Aside from the pure insanity, the food was pretty good. It was decently priced, they gave out fair portion sizes. The staff was as attentive as you can be with how busy they were. I had no negative Ncounters (get it?) with staff so that was a plus. Overall a good experience with good food. 

I'm not one for big crowds generally so I don't see myself coming back in the future. But if you want a trendy Brunch spot on mill this is a good bet..

We came for a late brunch on Saturday and the food was delicious! We ordered the classic benny, ultimate BLT, and pecos grilled chicken sandwich, and each person loved their food. I tried a bite of everything and it was all very tasty. I'm glad we came here on a whim and will probably be back.
Good selection on the menu,  food is yummy,  and fair priced. Can be quite busy sometimes,  mainly when classes are in session,  but overall good place to get breakfast in downtown Tempe area.

The bananas foster French toast was delicious but my favorite was the pear omelette! I would have never thought that the combo of pear, cheese, bacon, almonds &  eggs would work. It would have received 5 stars if it didn't take them about 20 minutes to bring out my food when it wasn't even that busy.

First time at Ncounter and seemed super popular if the line indicated anything! You stan walk up and order your good, get a letter, and they bring it out to you. The restaurant was clean and they ran it smoothly. 

The food was super tasty and all I had was a salad and a cup of soup!! Definitely recommended!
So fresh and delicious and affordable. Very worth a trip to down town mill and the terrible parking (parking on the street is free before 11 btw)

Bananas Foster French Toast is the bomb!  Split the plate with a friend today - it was great to share... but I really wanted my own in the end!  ;)  The sauce on the toast was sweet without being too sugary.  
i love their iced coffee!  great spot for breakfast!

They have a walk up counter for ordering, makes it pretty quick!

Do you even go to ASU if you have eaten at Ncounter a shameful amount of times??? I've probably tried most of their menu and I gotta tell you... It really is all so good. #1 in my heart is always gonna be the loaded omelet but since that's a very aggressive breakfast I usually just get the simple two eggs, sourdough, and sausage or bacon with potatoes. The most perfect breakfast potatoes you've ever had!! And for lunch you must get the chicken focaccia sandwich! Staff is always so nice and food comes out in a timely manner :) love you Ncounter
Everything looked so Good and everyone in my party of 12 liked their meals as well.  It was very busy, but that's a good thing so if you made it later in the morning it would be a little calmer

I ate here last Sunday and we placed
Our order and were served in a timely manner. My friend ordered the huevos ranchero.rdered the farmers market eggs Benedict with a side of
Canadian bacon. After trying different eggs Benedict at different restaurants across different cities, I was sad to say this wasn't the best I've tried. The hollandaise sauce was overpowering and very thick. The avocado was past its peak of ripeness and the tomato lacked succulence. I did however enjoy my cup of vanilla latte. I had the chance to try the huevos ranchero and it was mediocre at best. I would come here again but wouldn't order what I go ever again. I did like the atmosphere and loved the outdoor seating.

I also loved the way and ease of ordering. The servers were quick to give us our food and even if it was crowded their service was top notch.

This place is so good, I had the grilled cheese sandwich and it was amazing, maybe one of the best i have ever had! The girls are awesome that work here. Good place to cure a hangover or keep the party going.
Awful,people are rude.  Food and coffee are not good. They were rude to people at phx film festival. Food is not cooked all the way.  Review is true, correct the problem DoNotAttack Reviewer

Blown away by the food and atmosphere of the place. I hate finding parking on Mill, but will definitely make another trip back to this place. The potatoes were DELICIOUS. They looked sort of plain, but they made up in flavor and taste. I like these potatoes more then Snooze hash browns 

Highly Recommend:
-Chipotle Burrito 
-Red velvet waffles

This was my first time eating at Ncounter and I was disappointed. I love biscuits and gravy and they only offer it on Saturdays so I was really looking forward to trying it. The biscuit was okay but the gravy was Bland and the sausage tasted like Frozen sausage crumbles. There was also a bone in my gravy. The coffee was just okay the only thing that was actually good was the bacon. The cashier was friendly but the rest of the staff seem pretty indifferent. I could have spent $6 at Denny's for the same quality of food that I paid $12 at Ncounter. Since I haven't tried anything else here I don't want to give a negative recommendation but I wouldn't spend money in this place again.
This was a decent place for breakfast. It's defiantly a college town type of place. If you are looking for somewhere more sophisticated, I would look elsewhere.

I visited Ncounter this morning on the suggestion of some article about the "Top 10" places to enjoy breakfast in Tempe. To this restaurant's immense credit, they advertise very well with beautiful pictures, a simple but sleek interior, and great customer service.

On the suggestion of the cashier (which was a good suggestion, I might add), I ordered the pear omelet. It's an interesting but truly workable flavor combo of sliced peers and bacon with a side of potatoes. That beings said: 

- Food was unacceptably dry. There are two possibilities as to why: either the chef overcooked my meal, or my meal had been left out for a bit longer than it should have been, which leads me to my next thing 
- Long wait time. I went at 7:30 AM; there were about 8 other customers there, most of whom had already been served. My wait time was over 20 minutes, which was probably not necessary. 
- Coffee was not good. If you prefer simple, drip, black coffee like I do, you're better off getting it from elsewhere. Always be wary about the self-serve containers. No thermal container adequately masks how long ago a coffee was made, and mine was way too sour. They do have a nice menu of specialty coffee drinks which may be more worthwhile. 

I'm disappointed because this place, as I said earlier, advertises very well. Looks can obviously be misleading. However, I am open to coming back another time to give them another shot. Perhaps I'll try their Eggs Benedict next time. Until then, I shall......Ncounter other places (sorry, couldn't resist).

Busy restaurant but the long line to order went thru really fast. Everything I saw come out looked amazing and the smells very even better! Loved gluten free waffles and yogurt with fresh fruit and granola. Looking forward to next time!!
This place is super casual, you order at the counter. But because of that the prices are cheap and they have some good cocktails and a good super casual quick bite atmosphere. We'll be back.

This location is by far better then the Tempe one. The food here seems fresher and staff were nice and attentive. It was a rather dead Monday, only one other couple in the restaurant. The girl working the bar was accommodating and attentive. I got the French toast with bananas (it was so good), boyfriend got a scramble and his mom got a blue berry waffle which she also said she liked. I think prices are on the cheap side, which is nice for a change considering the generous portion. I think once people get more knowledge of the location there and the apartments above fill up this place will be more of a hit.

I wanted this to be so good. Food is not cooked well.  You can tell it is all frozen and has that kind of aftertaste.  It also took a long time, 10 minutes for food to come out and it was empty.  Then when I got the food the eggs had been way over cooked. 

Not ben sure why I gave them 2 stars. Good cappuccino.

Liked the menu but maybe not as good as it sounds.  I tried the ncounter omelette with chicken, broccoli, mushrooms, cream cheese and hollandaise sauce. Filling yes but could use a few key improvements.

The tomato on top looks nice but makes for a soggy warm tomato mess. Partially steamed tomatoes can be eliminated from the world without much changing. I am certain that the broccoli was previously frozen. I know some may say picky but why not opt for fresh broccoli? A little cheaper despite a little more prep work for the staff.  (You can tell previously frozen broccoli from the texture and water that is folded into the omelette.)  

The potatoes were meh. The generous seasoning sprinkled on them tried to mask the deep fried-then put on the grill to reheat look and texture. Same as the broccoli, why not up your game and make fresh potatoes?

The eggs were fluffy and the hollandaise was standard for a packaged hollandaise. Just add butter right?

I will give this place (or perhaps an encounter and the other ncounter in Tempe) another chance as the chipotle egg burrito sounds like a winner despite having those same pesky potatoes.

Great brunch spot. Somewhat limited menu, but there is a good variety to choose from. Order at the register and seat yourself. It was pretty crowded here on a Sunday morning, but there was enough seating (especially on the outside patio), that there wasn't much issue finding a seat. My girlfriend and I both had the red velvet waffles here and they were great. Although, they were sweet enough with the frosting that we didn't use any of the maple syrup they came with. The turkey sausage was also a good side - although it was actually 3 patties, rather than a sausage link. Overall, it's a nice casual place for brunch right on Mill Ave; just make sure to get here outside of peak hours if it's hot outside and you want to find a seat indoors.

I've come here on two separate occasions and probably won't be coming back again. The first time I had one of their hot sandwiches, and it was absolutely drowning in grease - I used up 5 napkins just wiping down my fingers - and the chicken inside wasn't very warm. Overall, really bad.

Next time, I thought I'd try a breakfast item instead and ordered the French toast. What I got were two gigantic pieces of bread, one of which was an end (all crust --- really?) and it tasted bad. Either the bread was old, or one of the ingredients to make it wasn't fresh, because it had a strange flavor to it. 

The only good I tried here were the sides (grilled potatoes and sausage patties). The interior is also nice and modern. Otherwise, I would stay far away from this place until they learn to make food that tastes good and doesn't seem old, flavorless, and isn't drowning in grease.

We used to like this place when mimosas and bloody mary's were $5, now they are $8 and $9 respectivly and served in plastic glasses, yikes!! The garnish on the bloody was a lime, no celery, olive or asparagus ! There is a frozen rose for $9. as well. Really? The cheap drinks were the reason we were willing to put up with the counter ordering system, which is dumb because there are 10 servers milling around, why not just take orders? It's not formal enough to take out of town guests, but not cheap either. We enjoyed the food last time, but didn't stay this time because of the hefty drink prices in plastic cups. The bar and service staff was very friendly and inviting, so if you don't want to get your drink on, go here!!!!

Easily one of my favorite breakfast places in Tempe! It comes across as high-end, but casual at the same time. Whether you're a sweets for breakfast person, or are more a fan of the savory omelet, eggs benedict, biscuits and gravy side of the aisle, Ncounter does it all very well. They also offer a variety of well-done breakfast cocktails like mimosa, greyhounds, and bloody marys. So far I have not been disappointed by anything I've tried here.

The omelets I've had here have been incredibly fresh, all the ingredients certainly chopped/cooked on the spot. They have so many options when it comes to additions that I'm certain anyone can find something they'll like. Ncounter can get pretty creative, I personally appreciate the Greek and pear omelets, as well as the variety of eggs benedict combinations.

I've also tried the french toast and it was very fluffy, perfectly fried. Also, the french toast was huge portion-wise. I'm not sure how they do it, if they just have giant loaves of homemade bread or what but it works.

Ncounter is upscale on the inside, but carries a laid-back vibe. You order at the counter, are given a number, and its up to you to find a table to have your food delivered to. This can be one of the only downsides (though a good problem for them to have) is that finding a table on a weekend can be pretty challenging. They do have misters on the patio but in the heat of summer they only help so much. 

Overall, Ncounter is great place for breakfast/brunch on the weekend, especially with their extensive cocktail selection if you're into that. For what you get, it's not much more expensive than any other decent breakfast place in town however I don't see it being the best place for families/kids. Breakfast is going to run you $10 per person, $15ish if you get a mimosa or something like that but I can sincerely say the quality is well worth it, you won't be disappointed. Get there early enough to hunt down a decent table and you're golden. I wouldn't recommend the patio after 10/11 in the summer.

This wasn't my first time coming here, but I was definitely impressed with the food this time. Ordered the Greek omelet, which I have gotten before but was so much better now, and the red velvet waffles. Everything was so good, nice outdoor seating, will be back for sure!

I would apologize for any color I may have left on your counters, walls or chairs.  I stumbled into this location after doing the Color Run.  This is such a cute new eatery.  After ordering, me and my friends could not stop drooling over all the plates that were coming out.  Everything looked AMAZING!!!  I decided to try the Pear Omelet and I was not disappointed.   Pear, Havarti cheese, and almonds.....so delicious! My friends were raving about their dishes.  Great location and awesome service!  I can't wait to go back to try more items off their menu.

Nice spot, cool decorating.  I had a chicken sandwich on focaccia bread and I felt like the bread was really too thin, it couldnt hold up.  Great flavors though, and still worth checking out for sure.  A nice addition to Mill ave.

I love coming to NCounter! Truly one of the best places for breakfast in the area. I've dined here at various times with a large group, by myself, and with a few friends. So it appears that the place never settles down and is always busy no matter the time of day nor season.

Food is amazing! I never know what to order because it's an extensive list and everything sounds tasty. Then I have to ponder the drink menu- mimosa? smoothie? Cartel cold brew? Hair-pulling decisions to make! The last few times I've ordered an omelette plate with potatoes, just love the simplicity of it. Friends also have noted love for their breakfast burrito and smoothies! They have a fairly simple bar menu for those who need a drink with brunch. The mimosas I've had are nothing special, almost too much OJ and not enough champs. 

Their people are great too. Anytime I walk up to order it's always been with a smile and a pleasant non-fake greeting. Recently the only free table was slightly dirty, but the manager came by to clean it up and apologized for not being quick enough. 

Definitely worth the time and money to visit here!
Yummy OJ and delicious bacon! French toast had potential but wasn't cooked all the way. Eggs over easy were perfect!

Came here for breakfast after an overnight shift and was curious to try this place.  I ordered the chipotle breakfast burrito, cup of cold brew coffee and a turkey/bacon/avocado sandwich.  The food honestly was a let down in that the burrito and sandwich just lacked flavor straight up.  The presentations were nice, service was good but the star of the show (the food) just didn't show up.  I ended up dousing my burrito with hot sauce to get some kick and flavor.  The sandwich was over priced for what it is.  The cold brew just tasted like water.

Not everything on the menu is great (pancakes and burrito), but something are very tasty.  Best time to come is on the weekdays or when they first open, it's hard to find a seat on a weekend period.  

They have issues with their food and coffee being consistent from day but over time I've been satisfied enough.

Again, come early!

This is my favorite breakfast place to go to and I've never had a bad experience till today. And it was 100% the worst food service experience i've ever had!! i came here on a Friday morning during winter break thinking since ASU isn't in session and everyone was home it'd be quick?- nope! It's usually pretty quick here anyway, I come all the time on Sundays when it's super crazy, sometimes I can't even find a table to sit at. Today it wasn't that busy at all but yet I waited for my food for an hour and a half!!!!!! When i noticed a few people who had ordered after me got their food already I went up and asked them to check on my order and explained how long we had been waiting and how people who ordered after us had their food they said "sorry 20 more minutes". 2 girls sitting next to us that had ordered before us didn't have their food either! Clearly someone messed up our orders. I decided to just get a refund and leave. So did the girls next to us! and of course that took like 15 minutes. 2 hours later I'm starving. I'm usually never a person who does something like this but that was horrible.

My Husband and I went this morning and everything was perfect!I like the Concept it's simple you order your food first and then you sit down and they will bring your food when it's ready! i gave a 5 star review because they deserve it!  the food is delicious and you can taste the freshness of their ingredients.the kitchen is Wide open so its easy to see how they operate and you can truly see that they use fresh ingredients.its was tasty and will definitely go back plus a lot of healthy choices!!

Breakfast was good. I came in for a place that sold turkey sausage. I have to say this was the most discussing turkey sausage. I'm wondering if it was actually park now. They said it was turkey. This jam doe the today is GREAT though. I asked for more. It must be apple and honey. Anyway it's great.
Loved it! The Greek omelet was great! I also had a bite of their French toast and I was very pleased. You have to try this place.

This was such a pleasant experience. I had the special. It was a sandwich on 12 grain bread...uh yeah, its good...with turkey and chilies and strawberry cream cheese, lets see there were field greens and melted jack on there too. Nothing but a slice of heaven! 
I asked for a recommend between the special and some other good sounding salad and the staff was friendly and smart about his tip. He said he tried the special, it was really good and not a lot of folks had ordered it. He recommended I get that since I could have the salad next time. Lucky thing it was great and yes, there will be a next time!

Line to order has five people, and two cashiers. Very tight space, and confusing to find end of line, and which way to queue.  Noise is deafening. I make eye contact with one cashier and she doesn't motion me over. I assume she is in training with the other cashier, and keep waiting.   Eventually I walk up and she asks how she can help me!  I said there's a whole line of folks who would love to be helped.  She says, "Well, I said I could help who's next!" as she inserts an eye roll and huffy sigh.  I explained it is loud, so we can't hear you speak, and placed my order.  

Fortunately my experience improved from there. Soft drink selection was good, although self-service area is very tight.  Took my number to the patio and my pear and bacon omelet appeared shortly.   It was lovely, and although the sliced almonds added a strange texture, the flavors blended well.  The fruit was ripe and sweet.  Server brought silverware and a tiny napkin in a logo paper bag, cute!  He was very efficient and brought hot sauce and cleared tables quickly. 

It began to rain so I moved inside and took a table.  I could then observe clearly how the line worked when there were 15 people in  it.  Much clearer.  Glad I missed the rush!

Used to come here quite a bit then it went drastically downhill. College kids that don't care about their work behind the counter, cold food, and mediocre coffee. Those three things define this place for me.

Not bad, but not great. The chilaquiles were sweet, and not traditional at all, but had a good texture despite the weird taste. The market benedict was also okay: ingredients were good and fresh, the hollandaise was unremarkable, and it came out lukewarm. At least the coffee was tasty, and the service was very good.

NCounter is one of those places that I'm very surprised it's not a yelp 5 star. 

I bring my girlfriend here, my boss, my parents, my friends, clients, etc. Every single time (30+) everything has been fantastic. 

Great environment, great food and nice people.
Chopped salad is amazing but bananas foster French toast is excessively drenched in syrup and butter, and served with syrup and butter on the side!! Environment is great.

Nice vibe here. Cool setting, however, the portions are a bit small. I have had 4 different things and each time I come away slightly hungry and have to fill up with water. 

I would suggest to management that the menu on the wall be changed where people can read it from a distance and two, make it legible. 

Outside of those small things, this is a very good place to try different ways to make breakfast and other items.

The newest installment of Ncounter opened in North Scottsdale. We ordered the red velvet waffles, croque monsieur, huevos n' chorizo, and P&B smoothie. Everything tasted delicious! The red velvet waffles were fluffy and with a white glazed, dipped in syrup they tasted heavenly. The Croque Monsieur dripped with gruyere cheese and the yolk burst into a yellow goodness that topped the humongous sandwich. The salsa in the huevos n' chorizo made the dish, and the P&B smoothie tasted just as it should, like P&B!

Sweet heavens there's a good breakfast place on Mill now!

NCounter is fast, fun, and tasty. Great portions, good variety, well-executed meals. I've been three times this week, and I've noticed a few minor missteps, but it's their first week and they're off and running.

Loved the bananas foster french toast (though the bananas were a little cool, as was the bacon that came with), not sure if they use real maple syrup, since it was coated in awesome... wouldn't mind clarification on that.

A bit annoyed that they only have Minute Maid lemonade, and a few other things seem to be more quick-and-dirty versions than home-grown versions (the potatoes for instance, which are tasty, but don't strike me as homemade like Liberty Market's or Matt's Big Breakfast.)

Fantastic toast and jam, and good eggs. I tried their chicken sandwich on Foccacia today and it was delightful. Good portion, delicious, and perfectly cooked.

The atmosphere is fun, the cupcakes are dangerously dense and delicious, the seating is flexible, and the service was incredibly friendly and darn fast. 

I wish a few things were a bit higher quality, but that's because I've been spoiled to death by Matt's & Liberty's take-no-prisoners approach. NCounter is a great fit, they've done great things with the space, and seriously: three times this week, the office has trekked on down there.
What a great location and some good food. professional, clean and friendly service/company!

Delicious place to grab salads or sandwiches on mill ave! The kale salad and chopped salad are amazing. Service is quick and place is clean. Highly recommend you go if you want a lighter and healthier option than most of the mill ave restaurant choices.

This place has made me a certified breakfast believer. SO and I were looking for some breakfast after a long morning of Pokehunting and stumbled upon this gem. The outside is underwhelming but once you go in, you're transported into this chic and very tastefully decorated breakfast bar with a great selection. I felt like I just left soul cycle in New York and came here for some coffee with my rich friends lol anyways, the selection was great and the simple breakfast (I think that's what it was called) really hit the spot. A new favorite!
So happy this finally opened downtown! Best lunch place. The chopped salad is the best!

Just got the Waldorf salad as takeout from here. OMG it was SO good. Frankly, I wasn't expecting it to be that great because this place gets an automatic crowd being on the Main Street.  The ingredients were top quality. The chicken was DELICIOUS. That's not a given. I live nearby and never choose this place because I am always looking for "off the beaten path," but now I will definitely be back!

I came here with my friend around ~10 or 11 am on a Saturday, and the place was packed. The line was nearly out the door. You order at the counter, get a number, and then find a table at which a waiter will come find you with your meal. 

I ordered the Original Chop Salad [$10] because the pictures that I had seen of it online were gorgeous. My friend had the Classic Eggs Benedict [$9].

The chop salad is as beautiful as it looks in pictures. It's delicious too. The salad dressing is a light pesto sauce that coats your salad just enough. I hate when the dressing is so overpowering or when the salad is drenched in sauce. 

There were some spots on the street available (you have to pay by the hour), so it wasn't too much of an issue.

The moment you walk in you will feel this good vibe and energy of people. Alexandra takes my order with great smile and friendliness. I had a loaded with a side of spring mix, it was a good breakfast.

Since the place is crowded, it takes a long time to get your order. I came here with my coworkers for lunch and we had to wait 30 minutes for food. 

It is also hard to find any empty table to sit; so one of us had to wait for the table while the rest of us ordered our food. This is not a place where you sit down and the waiter takes your order. 

Food was okay overall; it was not the best meal I ever had and it wasn't the worst either. 
I would probably go back when it is less busy. If we didn't have to wait, I would have given a rating of 3 or 4.

Nice out on the patio for brunch. Dog friendly as well.  Super cuteee!!! Great atmosphere, great staff 


The peanut butter cookie was phenomenal! 
I loved my portobello sammich with the salad on the side. I should have asked for the dressing on the side. They put so much dressing on it that I couldn't taste the salad.   great presentation by the way,  of course I took a picture of it. Haha :)

I am so coming back!!! Weeeee

Great breakfast and lunch spot. You would want to go here for dinner, too, but it closes at 3:05 p.m. I've wondered why it's 3:05, but I decided that maybe it's to give you 5 minutes to get in at the last minute. If not, oh well that's just my speculation. I have found it difficult to order because everything on the menu sounds good. I have eaten and loved the Banana's Foster French Toast, the Loaded Omelette and the Turkey Pesto on Focaccia. Yum Yum Yum. Oh I almost forgot I had the Blueberry Blast Smoothie and it was delicious- pretty much everything is good! They are also right next to the light rail. I like that A LOT! But beware, it's always busy, so it might not be a good place if you literally only have minutes. Another plus, is the patio is dog friendly. The patio is my favorite place to sit because of the great people watching opportunities on Mill Ave, but I wish it was a little bigger.

We decided to ride the light rail from end to end for something to do. We were going to get off at Mill and grab a bite at Whichwich but they were closed. Their loss. Ended up going here and it was great.  It was busy and filled with ASU students and hikers of A mountain. I got the original chopped salad. See pic. It was outstanding. If you've read any of my reviews you know it takes a lot to impress me and they did. My husband had the loaded omelette and also enjoyed that. See pic. We will definitely go back.

The line is long on the weekend, but it moves fast. They Will also take your order at the bar.  I had the pancakes and they were pretty good. It's too big for me to eat so I ended up taking some home. I also in the past tried the salad I believe it was had kale and chicken and it was very good. 

It's a good place to stop if you're on Mill Avenue. It is quite loud though during its busy times.

The Sunday morning hangover brunch crowd Nside Ncounter was almost exclusively sorostitutes and their frat bros wearing outfits that made me increasingly nauseated. ...We were off to a good start.

I ordered the carbs bonanza, aka the granola pancakes, aka two very large, plain pancakes with granola sitting on top of them, served with fake maple syrup. I was hoping they meant the granola was Nside the pancake, but sometimes my menu Nferences stem from too high of expectations. It was not impressive, if you hadn't deduced that from my tone, but it was made of enough wheat to soak up Nything you may or may not have consumed the night before.

Would I recommend Ncounter? Not N particular. But if you're N the area? It does the trick.

This place gets super busy!! But, I can see why... it was good food in a great Mill Ave location. Everything on the menu sounded good and everything I saw on other tables looked great.  If you go, just be prepared to wait in a line and scope out a table!

Great food, great atmosphere! If there is something on the menu you're in the mood for, you won't be disappointed. If you pick at random, you probably won't be disappointed. When you see what others are eating at thier table, you'll wish you ordered what they have. .  . until you get yours.

So good! Came here for brunch/lunch with a large group. Patio seating was nice! Split the kale salad which was really good (chicken, cranberries, edamame, tomatoes and sliced almonds with a light lemon dressing) and the pecos sandwich (chicken cheese and peppers) both were so good! Good for groups and some people ordered breakfast and really liked it. Would definitely
Go back here and next time get a mimosa!

Ncounter was an amazing breakfast spot! My friend and I went there during a weekday that we both had off and even though it was a little busy, the food came out at a somewhat quick speed, but good food does take time, so once we tasted our food, it was well worth the wait!

Came here on a recommendation for a fresh breakfast. I ordered the chipotle breakfast burrito and a flourless peanut butter muffin. Really good burrito! The chipotle sauce was really good and they were generous with the avocado. I often opt for egg whites which sometimes makes my food soggy, this didn't happen here. I'll definitely be coming back here soon!
Love, love, love Ncounter! This is the perfect place for a quick breakfast or lunch. I've enjoyed the Chipotle Egg Burrito and the Red Velvet Waffles-TO DIE FOR! I highly recommend Ncounter!

The only reason this place gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the location. Their food is amazing. My favorite is the pesto turkey and their vanilla lattes. I usually call in for takeout because it's always packed. I love bringing lunch home from Ncounter and enjoying it on my patio. I crave it! It is slightly over priced but it's honestly worth it in comparison to other cafes and sandwich places. I personally feel like you get what you pay for. The only things I don't particularly care for is the location. I don't like searching for parking on Mill Ave just to walk into a massively crowded place where you have to shove yourself through the lines just to pay for your to go order. They really need to open another location to accommodate the number of people this place attracts. Preferably another location with a dedicated parking lot.

I LOVE NCounter!  They do breakfast well and have great dishes that are imaginative without going off the deep end.  If you like a Benedict and you are wild about cream cheese get the NCounter Omelets!  Seriously it is my go to item and it's like crack.  I also love that they have a protein smoothie on their menu so I enjoy my brunch with my man friend instead of getting stuck at some health food place.

With all this good food the place can get busy and slow which is the only negative thing I can say about it but I guess that is what happens when people find out that your food is freaking amazing.

I also love that I can order online for my to-go order.  Makes my life a lot easier with a few clicks of a button!
Stopped here for breakfast this morning.  It was awesome!  Great Service, good prices, delicious food!

Never as good as I want it to be. A fa√ßade of a boutique local goodness. Eating here is like watching reality television, in that it's very bad and we should all stop doing it

Consistently average food in a cool location with OK service. The only redeeming things about Ncounter (Jesus I hate the name even more now that I type it) are that I can crawl there from my condo and the coffee is self-serve.

The food I regrettably find myself coming back here for is the killer, a breakfast sandwich on ciabatta which is about 60% gorgonzola cheese and the rest dark personal shame and bacon.

In short, if you are trying to wake up tomorrow and do a little bit better than you did today, please skip Ncounter. This review was mostly to talk myself out of ever coming back here. Thank you for reading, God bless

Went here today for lunch and was not impressed at all. We are local adults and have been wanting to try it but rarely have lunch time free. Everyone was served except us and we had 1 sandwich and a cup of soup and half sand. The soup was okay but the sandwich was so dry I almost choked and had to ask for some type of sauce. The pesto mayo had no flavor at all.  We weren't sure why it took 20 mins when everyone in the place had been served that came in after and when we asked if was like why we bothered. Just not happy and won't be back. Unfriendly cashier as well. I can't stand when I pay someone's check and they don't even say hello!
Great eats and coffee with option for outdoor seating. Best of all....it's a dog friendly patio!

Love this place! It is a winner. Price is good and the food is excellent! Their coffee is decent, but not amazing. I am a huge fan of their lunch and morning cocktails. It really adds to the appeal of the place! Parking is the biggest bummer, the best idea is to park in the A Mountain lot across the street... But you have to pay :(

Great! My boyfriend and I walked in and it seemed crowded. That wasn't the case once we ordered and found a seat. The menu was a bit overwhelming for the first time being there. I decided on the farmers market bene and I don't regret that decision. Coffee was excellent and was self serve. The only thing I found to be weird was that there were no napkins/silverware on the counters. When the servers bring the food is when they napkins and silverware are given out. Besides that, everything went swimmingly.

I went in with high hopes. I've heard so many good things. I was kinda disappointed.  I was expecting a restaurant but there was no greeter, no real service. You place your order and scurry off to find a seat. We went at about 8:30 so were lucky there. 

The food was mediocre at best. I got an eggwhite omelette that was quite bland. The coffee was like kerosene and they even messed up the bacon! Not crunchy, just kind of dry and lifeless. For the price I expected better, a lot better. 

The potatoes and the toast were the best part of my meal. As far as the experience goes, good location in Tempe. Easy to find parking.  Not bad, but certainly nothing spectacular to make me want to go back.

Good place to eat and relax 
Clean place 
Great food 
Very helpful staff 
I am visiting Phoenix and asked the staff what to see and do while in town they were helpful on advice and polite I would certainly go back there again

I came here for breakfast with my love & my Oreo aka my puppy. It was a Sunday so it was a bit packed. 

I ordered the N counter omelette. This has all of my favorites in it. chicken, mushrooms, broccoli, cream cheese and hollandaise sauce. Everything was amazing, however I wish it came with more of the Hollandaise sauce. I also ordered the Melon Patch cocktail. This wasn't anything amazing to it. 

I really like this place a lot. The food is good and I like their outdoor patio and the fact that it's dog friendly so I can take my puppy. They'll even bring out a bowl of water for her. The only negative is I wish it was more restaurant style instead of waiting in line to order at the counter. Great place for breakfast/brunch though.

Pretty delicious and fresh. Modern atmosphere and delicious breakfast. I love the iced mocha and the tasty eggs with avocados,  english muffins, and spinach. They provide siracha sauce too! Mmmm

The only problem I had was that ordering area was two crowded and disorganized. It was hard to squeeze past people after I ordered.

When the food comes out right it's great... but it rarely does. I order extra crispy potatoes and bacon every time, every time my potatoes are cold or very under cooked. I'ts like they go out of their way to do the opposite of what I request. One time I bit into my pancake and the mix was running out, they didn't even cook it through. so I would say it's worth a shot because when its good its great, but don't get your hopes up.

This is my favorite breakfast spot in the Phoenix area! I used to live right by Tempe Town lake, and one of my favorite things to do on the weekends was to hike up A mountain and then grab brunch at Ncounter.  I always ordered either an omelet or the chopped salad. Delicious! And you can sit outside on the patio with your dog!

I really enjoy this place. So far I've had their blueberry muffin, coffee, french toast and chipotle breakfast burrito. They all did not disappoint. The breakfast burrito is very large, good enough to share with someone. I don't want to rehash what everyone else says. Come for the food and coffee - its worth it.

I am visiting from out of town and staying near the Phoenix airport. Decided to take the  light rail and was pleasantly surprised to find this place right in front of me when exiting the train. 

I ordered the eggs Benedict. Came with diced potatoes. I also ordered a coffee. Everything was good but nothing spectacular to rave about. I liked that the food wasn't greasy but the meal was slightly over priced in my opinion.

The guy at the register wasn't sure whether to address me as "sir" or "man" so he used both which was a bit weird. Haha overall good experience and a good place to come back to for breakfast. Again nothing to rave about but if you want breakfast and don't care to only try places worth traveling for, then you're good coming here.

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots on Mill Ave in Tempe (good for lunch too).  The food is perfect (eggs etc, sandwiches, salads) and quick (order at the counter and they deliver to your table). The staff is friendly and the place is clean.  Everything on the menu is delicious...I've tried it all.

It's right across from the light rail stop at 3rd & Mill.  There's also convenient parking half a block west in the garage.

So here are a few problems to keep in mind before you go (you should go, but beware):

1). The drip coffee sucks. If you want a good coffee drink ask for it at the coffee counter....or walk a block south to Starbucks.  

2). There is only one electrical outlet for public use in the whole place. So charge your devices before you go. No, I won't tell you where it is but if you see me there I might share it with you.

3). During the ASU school year it is usually busy. But don't let the lines keep you away. They move surprisingly fast and you will be eating sooner than if you were to go elsewhere.
Had the eggs benedict and they were average.  The place was hopping though so they must be doing something right!

This is a Palo Alto wannabe!  It is clean, and the food is consistent for breakfast, but very uninspired.  I would say it is probably the best full service diner, I had been to in Tempe, AZ during my Sandy extended layover.  When I do return to the Tempe, AZ area it is probably one place that I may return to.

Love the environment of this place and there are many options to chose from. I went with the morning glory omelette and a side of fruit. The tomatoes were marinated to perfection and the omelette was super delicious. Only complaint is the weak coffee!

While not the most spectacular breakfast I've ever had, there were a lot of good options from healthy to calorie-packed. Good for large parties because you pay at the counter and they bring you the food (no awkward splitting of checks). Glad to see some new places on Mill, hope it sticks around.
Fantastic brunch for my whole family. Really enjoyed the granola/fruit and waffles. My boys loved the bacon and french toast. Would definitely go back next time we are in town.

This place is a great pick me up and just what the body needs after the night before.  They have a good vibe and pride themselves on the atmosphere they offer.  The food is good basic breakfast food.

The day that I was there, it was dirty.  Yes it was fairly busy but they really needed more attention to the tables.  

The food was fresh and the orange juice was delightful.
Have never been there for lunch, but the breakfast menu is very good!  My husband loves the red velvet waffles, and I usually order the huevos and chorizo saute ... YUM!!
A decent breakfast place in downtown Tempe. Not my absolute favorite, but pretty tasty and a good spot on Mill.

This place is packed during lunchtime. It was difficult to find a seat, but the wait was worth it. I ordered the Portobellini sandwich with a salad. I was so amazing. The ciabatta bread was warmed to perfection and the veggies were so tasty. The balsamic mayo is what really made the difference. It brought all the flavors together and tasted like heaven. I will have to come back to try their breakfast, of course. We had to sit outside and it was a bit warm, but their patio is great and will be perfect when the weather is cooler. The staff was friendly and fast, which counts for a lot when you have to order at a counter and the place is packed. I will definitely be back.

Usually when I find something I like at a restaurant, it's the only thing I'll ever order. At NCounter I have to try something different every time, and have yet to be disappointed. My only complaints are that they are on the slow side, yet they always seem to have a ton of asu students working. Would be 5 stars if the wait was less than 15 minutes for a to go sandwich!

Good Brunch spot on Mill Ave! Fairly quick service. The setup is easy, an Order Here and sit anywhere flow. I have only been a couple of times, but the bellinis and mimosas are delicious. As well as the breakfast eggs, toast and grilled potatoes combo.  Parking is metered with a parking lot located directly across the street. Extremely close access to the light rail.
Cute little place with good food.  The breakfast every time we've eaten here is amazing.

I really like that Mill has another option for the working crowd nearby. With our office down the street, I was growing pretty tired of the uber college pub-deli-pizza routine, in fact I drive away from this areas most days. But NCounter is a nice addition: cool space and a much needed revival on this corner. The remodel was done beautifully and the place gets so much more traffic now than it ever did with a crepe and coffee shop. Kudos to opening something comfortable enough to sit down in but quick enough for take out.

The food has been decent in my experience. Having ordered several meatless entrees from both the breakfast and lunch menus, my consensus is that the quality and creativity is pretty much what I'd expect from any Mill Ave establishment. Not knock-your-socks-off, but much better than drive thru. The presence of some healthy options is appealing. The egg white omelette was ok, but relatively flavorless even with tomato, peppers (still raw), avocado and cilantro. I usually get the Portobello sandwhich veganized with no cheese or mayo, but they've messed up my order a few times for take out, meaning I don't realize the cheese is on there until I've walked back to the office. I do wish the counter staff would pay a little more attention when customers order, but they aren't rude.

Can't say I'm a regular, but it's good to have a decent nearby option that's not burgers and fries. I do love scheduling "meetings" here just to get out of the office.

I've been here once before, this time I was disappointed.

Cooks in the back are eating, eating, not tasting, (mind you I know the difference) in the back while they cook, stuffing bread into their mouths. I didn't see him wash his hands...
Now I can overlook that but then I ordered the Crack O' Dawn saute and it said GRILLED potatoes. Mine were definitely fried. 
But they did change them for me so I will give them one extra star for that. 

Overall, the result was a greasy plate with mediocre food. But the service was decent and the place looked relatively clean.

This is a great place for breakfast or lunch.  Their food is VERY good.  When crowded, the food will arrive slowly and for one person at a time....... The staff is very friendly and the prices are not bad.  You can do some people watching while here as it is on Mill Avenue and it seems to be a college kid hang out (don't let that scare you as the crowd is very diverse).
I went to n counter for lunch yesterday. It was fantastic. Definitely a place to go when in Arizona

This place is great for breakfast. Staff where friendly and engaging, the crowd is good looking and the coffee is self serve so you can choose all your flavourings and extras. Nice to sit at the bar and people watch! Also they offer a healthy options menu! DELISH!
Great spot on Mill for breakfast or lunch. Clean & modern inside, great food, and quick service.

My boyfriend loves this place and as much as I also WANT to love it, there are some nagging negatives about NCounter that need to be resolved before I can.

Please note- if you request cheese to be added to your eggs, be prepared to be presented with an enormous GLOP of cheap, greasy cheese smothering the entire plate of eggs. I thought this was a fluke the first time I went, but on each subsequent visit the same thing has occurred. Last time I asked for *light* cheese and again I was presented with a massive dump of cheese on my eggs. And the quality of the cheese is not good unfortunately. It's greasier than a lot of what I "NCounter" elsewhere.

See what I did there? ;-)

The second time we visited, I ordered the red velvet waffles and the batter was way undercooked. I loathe sending dishes back but felt forced to because I didn't want to get sick!

On the third visit I decided to be "safe" and get toast. Well, hilariously the damn toast was burnt AF.  Can't cook waffles all the way through, but burn the toast.

Boyfriend's toast was also burnt. Maybe (hopefully) that will make him like this place less so we don't have to keep coming back!

I can't win at NCounter and thus, can't recommend it.

My coworkers and I always come here to grab a  quick smoothie from their bar. All their employees are super nice and friendly! My favorite smoothie off their menu is the PB&J smoothie. I haven't been able to try their breakfast or lunch yet but I will soon.

Really delicious breakfast with good coffee and a lot of choice. Much better than eating in the soulless hotel restaurant. Both high quality 'standard' breakfast items as well as more creative ones. For example, I had 'the pear', an omelette with pear, havarti, toasted almonds and bacon. Really yummy.

This is a great place on Mill for brunch.  I popped in in the middle of the week around 1130-12.  Surprisingly it wasn't too crowded with a busy lunch crowd. You walk in and order, they give you a number and bring your food to you.  

I had a cup of coffee and a loaded omelet with fruit as the side.  The omelet was deliciously huge and jam packed with ingredients.  The coffee was just average, I mean..it was in one of those metal towers I'm sure it was just old considering it was lunch time.  The place was very open and bright which is always nice for lunch.  

I'm looking forward to going back and trying their salad because they all looked great.  Service was fast and friendly, this is a great place to pop into for breakfast or lunch.

A really nice feel to the scenery. A very easy restaurant that was simple and cheap. Just walk up the counter, order, and wait. The only thing was how the food took a while to come out but that kind of thing happens in a busy restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious and a place I would go again.

I was hoping for a better addition to the downtown breakfast scene.  We went on a Monday morning and for a while were the only customers.  There were about 4 staff members, none of whom seemed at all friendly or interested in us.  We split a veggie omelette.  The omelette was above average but came with a side of obviously previously frozen potatoes.  Coffee was good.  I doubt we will be back however, since there are many other far superior places nearby for breakfast.  First Watch, Matt's Big Breakfast are two that come to mind.

I've found the perfect breakfast spot. Went on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was perfectly busy but we didn't have to wait for a table.  Had the Chipotle burrito and was pleasantly surprised how good this was. Probably the best I've had at a breakfast place. My BF had the loaded omelet.  He loved it (so did I). Food came out within 5 minutes.  The place has a great ambiance as well. I'm pretty picky about breakfast places but this place is great. We'll be back.

I've been here twice now and this place is as cute and fresh as it can be. First visit I had the eggs benedict with potatoes. The eggs benny were delicious, the orange juice was fresh and cold, but the potatoes were average. Second visit I had the pear omelette and a little bran muffin. That may not sound good to some, but this was absolutely delicious. Great taste and presentation. The service is very friendly here and though it's crowded, it's super-clean. I wouldn't hesitate to visit again. Might skip the potatoes though.

I never enjoy writing poor reviews but I feel strongly about this one. This place has so much potential but fails to meet expectations... consistently.

My coworkers and I used to come to NCounter very often for lunch, it was always packed but quick and the food was always on point. Recently though, it's taken 15-20 minutes to get food (not that long in the scheme of things but pretty long for fast casual). Worse than the wait though, the food has gone downhill. We keep going though, hoping this time will be better than the next, but always leave feeling disappointed. 

My old go-to was the Foccaccia Roma-Chicken, which is still probably the best item I've had there, but lately has only had the tiniest piece of chicken. The Cobb sandwich and Pecos Grille seem like safe bets but are less than impressive.

And worst of all, I ordered the tuna melt today and it had almost 0 tuna - all mayo, lettuce, and avocado. I tasted tuna in maybe 2 bites of the whole sandwich. My coworker mentioned she had the same experience and doesn't order that sandwich anymore (in her words, "Last time I had the tuna sandwich, I was so upset... like I'm almost called to let them know this is unacceptable" lol... This would have been nice to know before I ordered, right?!)

Because I work in the area, I've only ever had lunch here. It's possible that weekend breakfasts are completely different. And the menu options are great - a lot to choose from and healthy options too. The atmosphere is also a plus - the patio is perfect for nice Tempe days. 

I just feel that overall, there are is little attention paid to detail. If some simple adjustments were made - both in the kitchen and with staff - it would make the WORLD of difference.
Superb breakfast... French toast is a must!  Awkard closing time, just make sure you make it in before then!

Continue to come here for breakfast, been 8 or 9 times now and it still has yet to fail me. Today I had the santa fe sautee and it was delicioso!! There are so many options on the menu that it is hard to choose from, but I have definitely found 3 favorites on here.
